1.title: The Morning Breaks
lines: 1: The morning breaks, the shadows flee;
Lo, Zion’s standard is unfurled!
The dawning of a brighter day,
The dawning of a brighter day
Majestic rises on the world.
2: The clouds of error disappear
Before the rays of truth divine;
The glory bursting from afar,
The glory bursting from afar
Wide o’er the nations soon will shine.
3: The Gentile fulness now comes in,
And Israel’s blessings are at hand.
Lo, Judah’s remnant, cleansed from sin,
Lo, Judah’s remnant, cleansed from sin
Shall in their promised Canaan stand.
4: Jehovah speaks! Let earth give ear,
And Gentile nations turn and live!
His mighty arm is making bare,
His mighty arm is making bare
His cov’nant people to receive.
5: Angels from heav’n and truth from earth
Have met, and both have record borne;
Thus Zion’s light is bursting forth,
Thus Zion’s light is bursting forth
To bring her ransomed children home.

2.title: The Spirit of God
lines: 1: The Spirit of God like a fire is burning!
The latter-day glory begins to come forth;
The visions and blessings of old are returning,
And angels are coming to visit the earth.
Ch: We’ll sing and we’ll shout with the armies of heaven,
Hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!
Let glory to them in the highest be given,
Henceforth and forever, Amen and amen!
2: The Lord is extending the Saints’ understanding,
Restoring their judges and all as at first.
The knowledge and power of God are expanding;
The veil o’er the earth is beginning to burst.
Ch: We’ll sing and we’ll shout with the armies of heaven,
Hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!
Let glory to them in the highest be given,
Henceforth and forever, Amen and amen!
3: We’ll call in our solemn assemblies in spirit,
To spread forth the kingdom of heaven abroad,
That we through our faith may begin to inherit
The visions and blessings and glories of God.
Ch: We’ll sing and we’ll shout with the armies of heaven,
Hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!
Let glory to them in the highest be given,
Henceforth and forever, Amen and amen!
4: How blessed the day when the lamb and the lion
Shall lie down together without any ire,
And Ephraim be crowned with his blessing in Zion,
As Jesus descends with his chariot of fire!
Ch: We’ll sing and we’ll shout with the armies of heaven,
Hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!
Let glory to them in the highest be given,
Henceforth and forever, Amen and amen!

3.title: Now Let Us Rejoice
lines: 1: Now let us rejoice in the day of salvation.
No longer as strangers on earth need we roam.
Good tidings are sounding to us and each nation,
And shortly the hour of redemption will come,
Ch: When all that was promised the Saints will be given,
And none will molest them from morn until ev’n,
And earth will appear as the Garden of Eden,
And Jesus will say to all Israel, “Come home.”
2: We’ll love one another and never dissemble
But cease to do evil and ever be one.
And when the ungodly are fearing and tremble,
We’ll watch for the day when the Savior will come,
Ch: When all that was promised the Saints will be given,
And none will molest them from morn until ev’n,
And earth will appear as the Garden of Eden,
And Jesus will say to all Israel, “Come home.”
3: In faith we’ll rely on the arm of Jehovah
To guide thru these last days of trouble and gloom,
And after the scourges and harvest are over,
We’ll rise with the just when the Savior doth come.
Ch: Then all that was promised the Saints will be given,
And they will be crown’d with the angels of heav’n,
And earth will appear as the Garden of Eden,
And Christ and his people will ever be one.

4.title: Truth Eternal
lines: 1: Truth eternal, truth divine,
In thine ancient fulness shine!
Burst the fetters of the mind
From the millions of mankind!
2: Truth again restored to earth,
Opened with a prophet’s birth.
Priests of heaven’s royal line
Bear the keys of truth divine!
3: Truth shall triumph as the light
Chases far the misty night.
Endless ages own its sway,
Clad in everlasting day.

5.title: High on the Mountain Top
lines: 1: High on the mountain top
A banner is unfurled.
Ye nations, now look up;
It waves to all the world.
In Deseret’s
sweet, peaceful land,
On Zion’s mount
behold it stand!
2: For God remembers still
His promise made of old
That he on Zion’s hill
Truth’s standard would unfold!
Her light should there
attract the gaze
Of all the world
in latter days.
3: His house shall there be reared,
His glory to display,
And people shall be heard
In distant lands to say:
We’ll now go up
and serve the Lord,
Obey his truth
and learn his word.
4: For there we shall be taught
The law that will go forth,
With truth and wisdom fraught,
To govern all the earth.
Forever there
his ways we’ll tread,
And save ourselves
and bless our dead.

6.title: Redeemer of Israel
lines: 1: Redeemer of Israel,
Our only delight,
On whom for a blessing we call,
Our shadow by day
And our pillar by night,
Our King, our Deliv’rer, our all!
2: We know he is coming
To gather his sheep
And lead them to Zion in love,
For why in the valley
Of death should they weep
Or in the lone wilderness rove?
3: How long we have wandered
As strangers in sin
And cried in the desert for thee!
Our foes have rejoiced
When our sorrows they’ve seen,
But Israel will shortly be free.
4: As children of Zion,
Good tidings for us.
The tokens already appear.
Fear not, and be just,
For the kingdom is ours.
The hour of redemption is near.
5: Restore, my dear Savior,
The light of thy face;
Thy soul-cheering comfort impart;
And let the sweet longing
For thy holy place
Bring hope to my desolate heart.
6: He looks! and ten thousands
Of angels rejoice,
And myriads wait for his word;
He speaks! and eternity,
Filled with his voice,
Re-echoes the praise of the Lord.

7.title: Israel, Israel, God Is Calling
lines: 1: Israel, Israel, God is calling,
Calling thee from lands of woe.
Babylon the great is falling;
God shall all her tow’rs o’erthrow.
Ch: Come to Zion, come to Zion,
For your coming Lord is nigh.
Come to Zion, come to Zion,
Ere his judgments fall from high.
2: Israel, Israel, God is speaking.
Hear your great Deliv’rer’s voice!
Now a glorious morn is breaking
For the people of his choice.
Ch: Come to Zion, come to Zion,
For your coming Lord is nigh.
Come to Zion, come to Zion,
Ere his judgments fall from high.
3: Israel, Israel, angels call thee,
Serving God in courts above.
Zion’s land is now before thee;
God presents it in his love.
Ch: Come to Zion, come to Zion,
For your coming Lord is nigh.
Come to Zion, come to Zion,
Ere his judgments fall from high.

8.title: Awake and Arise
lines: 1: Awake and arise in the strength of your youth,
Ye sons and ye daughters of God,
And gird on the armor of virtue and truth
And walk in the path Jesus trod.
The future is beaming with promises bright;
A glorious work to be done.
Then awake and arise in your beauty and might;
The vict’ry will surely be won.
Ch: Arouse, then, arouse, for the foe is before;
The conflict will have to be won.
Then awake and arise, and be loyal and true,
And victory will crown what you do.
2: Let reason and right be your motto and guide;
Let virtue your actions control,
And in the great battle of life on the side
Of truth be each valiant young soul.
Let rev’rence and honor be giv’n to the name
Of God and his wonderful Son.
Let virtue and chastity lead you to fame,
And life’s greatest battle is won.
Ch: Arouse, then, arouse, for the foe is before;
The conflict will have to be won.
Then awake and arise, and be loyal and true,
And victory will crown what you do.

9.title: Come, Rejoice
lines: 1: Come, rejoice, the King of glory
Speaks to men from heaven again.
Hear ye not the thrilling story,
“Peace on earth, good will to men”?
Sing aloud the joyful chorus;
Join the mighty, angel throng.
Truth and light are beaming for us;
Tune your hearts to praise and song.
2: Now again the heav’ns are open;
We can hear the Savior’s voice.
See the signs, the promised token;
Let the righteous now rejoice.
Soon the Lord will come in power,
Gathering Israel to their own.
Then will dawn the glorious hour
When he’ll claim his rightful throne.

10.title: Come, Sing to the Lord
lines: 1: Come, sing to the Lord a new song;
Let the righteous in triumph rejoice!
Let the armies of Zion be strong
And lift up to heaven their voice.
Let the saints of the Lord in their might
Overcome every foe and prevail,
Till with joy in the mansions of light
Their success they with gladness shall hail.
2: Let the name of the Lord be adored,
And his praises be joyfully sung,
For the pow’r of his edict and word
O’er the earth is triumphantly flung.
Let the knowledge of God, as the seas,
Spread abroad till the nations shall own
That the Savior in glory decrees
From the height of his heavenly throne.
3: Let his people rejoice in their King,
The Beloved of heaven and earth,
And to Zion their holy gifts bring
Of devotion, and reverence, and worth.
Let them offer their hearts to the Lord,
Ever seek his direction and grace,
Till, according to his holy word,
They in glory shall see his bright face.

11.title: What Was Witnessed in the Heavens?
11.safe_title: What Was Witnessed in the Heavens
lines: 1: What was witnessed in the heavens?
Why, an angel earthward bound.
Had he something with him bringing?
Yes, the gospel, joyful sound!
It was to be preached in power
On the earth, the angel said,
To all men, all tongues and nations
That upon its face are spread.
2: Had we not before the gospel?
Yes, it came of old to men.
Then what is this latter gospel?
’Tis the first one come again.
This was preached by Paul and Peter
And by Jesus Christ, the Head.
This we latter Saints are preaching;
We their footsteps wish to tread.
3: Where so long has been the gospel?
Did it pass from earth away?
Yes, ’twas taken back to heaven
Till should dawn a brighter day.
What became of those departed,
Knowing not the gospel plan?
In the spirit world they’ll hear it;
God is just to ev’ry man.

12.title: 'Twas Witnessed in the Morning Sky
12.safe_title: Twas Witnessed in the Morning Sky
lines: 1: ’Twas witnessed in the morning sky:
A glorious angel, earthward bound,
Proclaiming news of gospel truth—
The everlasting, joyful sound.
A message to be preached abroad
In latter days, upon the earth,
To men of ev’ry tongue and clime,
To rich and poor, of humble birth.
2: ’Twas witnessed in the morning sky:
A new and wondrous star appear,
That shone so bright it seemed to tell
That news of some great joy was near.
And then a voice was heard from God,
The God of majesty and might,
Saying, “This is my beloved Son;
Oh, hear ye him, my soul’s delight.”

13.title: An Angel from on High
lines: 1: An angel from on high
The long, long silence broke;
Descending from the sky,
These gracious words he spoke:
Lo! in Cumorah’s lonely hill
A sacred record lies concealed.
Lo! in Cumorah’s lonely hill
A sacred record lies concealed.
2: Sealed by Moroni’s hand,
It has for ages lain
To wait the Lord’s command,
From dust to speak again.
It shall again to light come forth
To usher in Christ’s reign on earth.
It shall again to light come forth
To usher in Christ’s reign on earth.
3: It speaks of Joseph’s seed
And makes the remnant known
Of nations long since dead,
Who once had dwelt alone.
The fulness of the gospel, too,
Its pages will reveal to view.
The fulness of the gospel, too,
Its pages will reveal to view.
4: The time is now fulfilled,
The long-expected day;
Let earth obedience yield
And darkness flee away.
Remove the seals; be wide unfurled
Its light and glory to the world.
Remove the seals; be wide unfurled
Its light and glory to the world.
5: Lo! Israel filled with joy
Shall now be gathered home,
Their wealth and means employ
To build Jerusalem,
While Zion shall arise and shine
And fill the earth with truth divine.
While Zion shall arise and shine
And fill the earth with truth divine.

14.title: Sweet Is the Peace the Gospel Brings
lines: 1: Sweet is the peace the gospel brings
To seeking minds and true.
With light refulgent on its wings,
It clears the human view.
2: Its laws and precepts are divine
And show a Father’s care.
Transcendent love and mercy shine
In each injunction there.
3: Faithless tradition flees its pow’r,
And unbelief gives way.
The gloomy clouds, which used to low’r,
Submit to reason’s sway.
4: May we who know the sacred Name
From every sin depart.
Then will the Spirit’s constant flame
Preserve us pure in heart.
5: Ere long the tempter’s power will cease,
And sin no more annoy,
No wrangling sects disturb our peace,
Or mar our heartfelt joy.
6: That which we have in part received
Will be in part no more,
For he in whom we all believe
To us will all restore.
7: In patience, then, let us possess
Our souls till he appear.
On to our mark of calling press;
Redemption draweth near.

15.title: I Saw a Mighty Angel Fly
lines: 1: I saw a mighty angel fly;
To earth he bent his way,
A message bearing from on high
To cheer the sons of day.
Truth is the message which he bears,
The gospel’s joyful sound,
To calm our doubts, to chase our fears,
And make our joys abound.
2: He cries, and with a mighty voice;
Ye nations lend an ear,
And isles and continents rejoice:
The great Redeemer’s near!
He cries; let ev’ry ear attend,
And thrones and empires all!
Fear God, and make the Lord your friend,
The King, the Lord of all!
3: Fear God, who made the water pure,
The heavens, sea, and land.
His judgment will be swift and sure;
The day is nigh at hand.
Then, all ye people, worship God;
Give glory to his name!
To spread these tidings far abroad
The holy angel came.

16.title: What Glorious Scenes Mine Eyes Behold
lines: 1: What glorious scenes mine eyes behold!
What wonders burst upon my view!
When Ephraim’s records I unfold,
All things appear divinely new.
All things appear divinely new.
2: Good news to earth have angels borne,
Which fills our souls with joy and peace.
Good tidings comfort those who mourn
And bring the captive full release,
And bring the captive full release.
3: The scattered sheep, who once were sold
In darkness o’er the mountains far,
Shall now return unto their fold
And there their waiting hearts prepare,
And there their waiting hearts prepare.
4: Now Israel, long oppressed and grieved
In ev’ry land, in ev’ry clime,
Shall hear the word of God and live;
This is the time, the chosen time.
This is the time, the chosen time.

17.title: Awake, Ye Saints of God, Awake!
lines: 1: Awake, ye saints of God, awake!
Call on the Lord in mighty prayer,
That he will Zion’s bondage break
And bring to naught the fowler’s snare.
2: He will regard his people’s cry;
The widow’s tear, the orphan’s moan.
The blood of martyrs from the ground,
The suff’ring saint, the pris’ner’s groan.
3: And he will pedestal his law,
And his executives sustain;
He will protect them by his pow’r,
And they shall triumph and shall reign.

18.title: The Voice of God Again Is Heard
lines: 1: The voice of God again is heard;
The silence of the ages broken.
The promise of the Lord restored;
A new and living word is spoken.
Upon the chosen mountain height
The ensign of the Lord is streaming.
The gospel banner, broad and bright,
With hope and peace and promise beaming.
2: No more in chains of darkness bound,
The humbled, penitent may listen.
Upon the consecrated ground
The dews of inspiration glisten.
The shadows of the past are gone;
The mists of doubt and fear are clearing.
Behold the everlasting dawn!
The coming of the Lord is nearing.

19.title: We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet
lines: 1: We thank thee, O God, for a prophet
To guide us in these latter days.
We thank thee for sending the gospel
To lighten our minds with its rays.
We thank thee for every blessing
Bestowed by thy bounteiful hand.
We feel it a pleasure to serve thee
And love to obey thy command.
2: When dark clouds of trouble hang o’er us
And threaten our peace to destroy,
There is hope smiling brightly before us,
And we know that deliv’rance is nigh.
We doubt not the Lord nor his goodness.
We’ve proved him in days that are past.
The wicked who fight against Zion
Will surely be smitten at last.
3: We’ll sing of his goodness and mercy.
We’ll praise him by day and by night,
Rejoice in his glorious gospel,
And bask in its life-giving light.
Thus on to eternal perfection
The honest and faithful will go,
While they who reject this glad message
Shall never such happiness know.

20.title: God of Power, God of Right
lines: 1: God of power, God of right,
Thou who art our rock and might,
Hear us, as we humbly bow,
As we take upon us now
Ev’ry sacred vow.
2: By our cov’nant, we will be
Thine thru all eternity.
If we’re faithful, if we’re true,
All thy blessings will be new,
Fresh as morning dew.
3: Lord, our Sov’reign, make us one,
One with thee and with thy Son.
Give us strength to do thy will,
All thy counsels to fulfill,
Standing firm and still.

21.title: Come, Listen to a Prophet's Voice
21.safe_title: Come, Listen to a Prophets Voice
lines: 1: Come, listen to a prophet’s voice,
And hear the word of God,
And in the way of truth rejoice,
And sing for joy aloud.
We’ve found the way the prophets went
Who lived in days of yore.
Another prophet now is sent
This knowledge to restore.
2: The gloom of sullen darkness spread
Thru earth’s extended space
Is banished by our living Head,
And God has shown his face.
Thru erring schemes in days now past
The world has gone astray;
Yet Saints of God have found at last
The straight and narrow way.
3: ’Tis not in man they put their trust
Nor on his arm rely.
Full well assured, all are accursed
Who Jesus Christ deny.
The Savior to his people saith,
“Let all my words obey,
And signs shall follow living faith,
Down to the latest day.”
4: Then heed the words of truth and light
That flow from fountains pure.
Yea, keep His law with all thy might
Till thine election’s sure,
Till thou shalt hear the holy voice
Assure eternal reign,
While joy and cheer attend thy choice,
As one who shall obtain.

22.title: We Listen to a Prophet's Voice
22.safe_title: We Listen to a Prophets Voice
lines: 1: We listen to a prophet’s voice
And hear the word of God,
Believing that in his choice,
We walk a path well trod.
In these the latter days of time,
A prophet true is sent
To bring the gospel truths sublime,
That man may yet repent.
2: The heavens again have opened wide;
The veil is rent in twain.
An angel from on high did glide
To bring God’s truth again.
The record of the ancient dead,
From earth was brought to light,
That all who will may now be led
To walk in paths of right.

23.title: We Ever Pray for Thee
lines: 1: We ever pray for thee, our prophet dear,
That God will give to thee his tender care.
We ever pray for thee, our prophet dear.
That thy great mission thou wilt fulfill,
And that thy life the Lord will spare,
His righteous purpose to fulfill.
We ever pray for thee, our prophet dear,
That God will give to thee his tender care.
2: And we will ever pray for thee, our prophet dear.
Believing that the Lord will hear our prayer,
That he will ever heed our humble plea,
Our prophet ever bless and spare.
We ever pray for thee, our prophet dear,
That God will give to thee his tender care.
We ever pray for thee, our prophet dear,
That God will give to thee his tender care.

24.title: God Bless Our Prophet Dear
lines: 1: God bless our prophet dear;
Should ill winds fill the sky,
We will not fear, for he is near,
Our prophet, priest, and seer.
He will the Lord’s mind hear;
He’ll keep the channel clear,
And gospel truth will reach our youth.
God bless our prophet dear.
2: God bless our prophet dear;
May heaven’s light descend,
And God his holy spirit send
Our prophet to defend.
His sacred life to spare,
This is our daily prayer.
May God our prophet ever bless
And give his work success.

25.title: Now We'll Sing with One Accord
25.safe_title: Now Well Sing with One Accord
lines: 1: Now we’ll sing with one accord,
For a prophet of the Lord,
Bringing forth his precious word,
Cheers the Saints as anciently.
When the world in darkness lay,
Lo, he sought the better way,
And he learned to trust and pray,
So the Lord could set him free.
2: Now the heavens are opened wide,
And the blessings will abide,
If we’ll follow him as guide,
Walking in humility.
Praise the Father and the Son,
For the work that is begun,
And the vict’ry that is won,
Throughout all eternity.

26.title: Joseph Smith's First Prayer
lines: 1: Oh, how lovely was the morning!
Radiant beamed the sun above.
Bees were humming, sweet birds singing,
Music ringing through the grove,
When within the shady woodland
Joseph sought the God of love,
When within the shady woodland
Joseph sought the God of love.
2: Humbly kneeling, sweet appealing—
’Twas the boy’s first uttered prayer—
When the pow’rs of sin assailing
Filled his youthful soul with fear;
But undaunted, still he trusted
In his Heav’nly Father’s care,
But undaunted, still he trusted
In his Heav’nly Father’s care.
3: Suddenly a light descended,
Brighter far than noon-day sun,
And a shining, glorious pillar
O’er him fell, around him shone,
While appeared two heav’nly beings,
God the Father and the Son,
While appeared two heav’nly beings,
God the Father and the Son.
4: “Joseph, this is my Beloved;
Hear him!” Oh, how sweet the word!
Joseph’s humble prayer was answered,
And he listened to the Lord.
Oh, what rapture filled his bosom,
For he saw the living God,
Oh, what rapture filled his bosom,
For he saw the living God.

27.title: Praise to the Man
lines: 1: Praise to the man who communed with Jehovah!
Jesus anointed that Prophet and Seer.
Blessed to open the last dispensation,
Kings shall extol him, and nations revere.
Ch: Hail to the Prophet, ascended to heaven!
Traitors and tyrants now fight him in vain.
Mingling with Gods, he can plan for his brethren;
Death cannot conquer the hero again.
2: Praise to his memory, he died as a martyr;
Honored and blest be his ever-great name!
Long shall his blood, which was shed by assassins,
Plead unto heav’n while the earth lauds his fame.
Ch: Hail to the Prophet, ascended to heaven!
Traitors and tyrants now fight him in vain.
Mingling with Gods, he can plan for his brethren;
Death cannot conquer the hero again.
3: Great is his glory and endless his priesthood.
Ever and ever the keys he will hold.
Faithful and true, he will enter his kingdom,
Crowned in the midst of the prophets of old.
Ch: Hail to the Prophet, ascended to heaven!
Traitors and tyrants now fight him in vain.
Mingling with Gods, he can plan for his brethren;
Death cannot conquer the hero again.
4: Sacrifice brings forth the blessings of heaven;
Earth must atone for the blood of that man.
Wake up the world for the conflict of justice.
Millions shall know “Brother Joseph” again.
Ch: Hail to the Prophet, ascended to heaven!
Traitors and tyrants now fight him in vain.
Mingling with Gods, he can plan for his brethren;
Death cannot conquer the hero again.

28.title: Saints, Behold How Great Jehovah
lines: 1: Saints, behold how great Jehovah
Hath his blessings on you poured!
Still he is your gracious Father,
And he is your sov’reign Lord.
Give him praise for his great goodness,
For his mercy and his grace!
Sing his praise, ye sons of Zion;
Sing his praise, ye chosen race!

29.title: A Poor Wayfaring Man of Grief
lines: 1: A poor wayfaring Man of grief
Hath often crossed me on my way,
Who sued so humbly for relief
That I could never answer nay.
I had not power to ask his name,
Whereto he went, or whence he came;
Yet there was something in his eye
That won my love; I knew not why.
2: Once, when my scanty meal was spread,
He entered; not a word he spake,
Just perishing for want of bread.
I gave him all; he blessed it, brake,
And ate, but gave me part again.
Mine was an angel’s portion then,
For while I fed with eager haste,
The crust was manna to my taste.
3: I spied him where a fountain burst
Clear from the rock; his strength was gone.
The heedless water mocked his thirst;
He heard it, saw it, hurrying on.
I ran and raised the suff’rer up;
Thrice from the stream he drained my cup,
Dipped and returned it running o’er;
I drank and never thirsted more.
4: ’Twas night; the floods were out; it blew
A winter hurricane aloof.
I heard his voice abroad and flew
To bid him welcome to my roof.
I warmed and clothed and cheered my guest
And laid him on my couch to rest;
Then watched till morning’s dawn appeared,
And all my mingling joys endeared.
5: I saw him bleeding in his chains
For leaning to a helpless slave.
I knelt and bound his bleeding veins,
Nor did whit the scorners brave.
I shielded him from shame and wrong
And welcomed him, though much abused.
He was my friend, and I his soul
Refused the hand that decked his head.
6: Then in a moment to my view
The stranger started from disguise.
The tokens in his hands I knew;
The Savior stood before mine eyes.
He spake, and my poor name he named,
“Of me thou hast not been ashamed.
These deeds shall thy memorial be;
Fear not, thou didst them unto me.”

30.title: Come, Come, Ye Saints
lines: 1: Come, come, ye Saints, no toil nor labor fear;
But with joy wend your way.
Though hard to you this journey may appear,
Grace shall be as your day.
’Tis better far for us to strive
Our useless cares from us to drive;
Do this, and joy your hearts will swell—
All is well! All is well!
2: Why should we mourn or think our lot is hard?
’Tis not so; all is right.
Why should we think to earn a great reward
If we now shun the fight?
Gird up your loins; fresh courage take.
Our God will never us forsake;
And soon we’ll have this tale to tell—
All is well! All is well!
3: We’ll find the place which God for us prepared,
Far away in the West,
Where none shall come to hurt or make afraid;
There the Saints will be blessed.
We’ll make the air with music ring,
Shout praises to our God and King;
Above the rest these words we’ll tell—
All is well! All is well!
4: And should we die before our journey’s through,
Happy day! All is well!
We then are free from toil and sorrow, too;
With the just we shall dwell!
But if our lives are spared again
To see the Saints their rest obtain,
Oh, how we’ll make this chorus swell—
All is well! All is well!

31.title: O God, Our Help in Ages Past
lines: 1: O God, our help in ages past,
Our hope for years to come,
Our shelter from the stormy blast,
And our eternal home!
2: Before the hills in order stood
Or earth received her frame,
From everlasting thou art God,
To endless years the same.
3: A thousand ages in thy sight
Are like an evening gone,
Short as the watch that ends the night
Before the rising sun.
4: Time, like an ever-rolling stream,
Bears all its sons away;
They fly forgotten, as a dream
Dies at the opening day.
5: O God, our help in ages past,
Our hope for years to come,
Be thou our guard while life shall last
And our eternal home.

32.title: The Happy Day at Last Has Come
lines: 1: The happy day at last has come.
Zion is built, and we are home.
Her halls are filled with prayer and praise,
And holy songs we love to raise.
We’ll serve the Lord with all our might;
We’ll seek his face by day and night;
We’ll learn to do his holy will;
We’ll love the place where he doth dwell.
2: O Lord, our God, we humbly pray
That thou wilt bless us here today.
Oh, send thy Spirit from on high
And bring thy great salvation nigh.

33.title: Our Mountain Home So Dear
lines: 1: Our mountain home so dear,
Where crystal waters clear
Flow ever free,
While thro’ the valleys wide
The flowers on every side,
Blooming in stately pride,
Are fair to see.
2: We’ll plow and sow and reap
The bounties of the deep,
Rich fruits and grain,
And of the treasure sought,
By skillful fingers wrought,
The finest fabrics brought
From hill and plain.
3: Let songs of joy resound;
Let every heart be found
From sin made free.
We’ll raise our voices high,
A happy, cheerful cry,
That will ascend the sky,
Our God, to thee.

34.title: O Ye Mountains High
lines: 1: O ye mountains high, where the clear blue sky
Arches over the vales of the free,
Where the pure breezes blow and the clear streamlets flow,
How I’ve longed to your bosom to flee!
Ch: O Zion! dear Zion! land of the free,
Now my own mountain home, unto thee I have come,
All my fond hopes are centered in thee.
2: Though the great and the wise all thy beauties despise,
To the humble and pure thou art dear.
Though the haughty may smile and the wicked revile,
Yet we love thy glad tidings to hear.
Ch: O Zion! dear Zion! land of the free,
Though the nations deride, I will cast them aside,
And rejoice to be numbered with thee.
3: In thy mountain retreat, God will strengthen thy feet;
On the necks of thy foes thou shalt tread.
And their silver and gold, as the prophets have told,
Shall be brought to adorn thy fair head.
Ch: O Zion! dear Zion! land of the free,
Soon thy towers shall shine with a splendor divine,
And eternal salvation be thine.

35.title: For the Strength of the Hills
lines: 1: For the strength of the hills we bless thee,
Our God, our fathers’ God.
Thou hast made thy children mighty
By the touch of the mountain sod.
Thou hast led thy chosen Israel
To freedom’s last abode.
For the strength of the hills we bless thee,
Our God, our fathers’ God.
2: The pioneer army is marching
On to their promised land,
Thro’ the wilderness of sages,
O’er the barren desert sand,
With the pillar of cloud before them,
By the guidings of thy hand.
For the strength of the hills we bless thee,
Our God, our fathers’ God.
3: When the earth is wrapped in slumber
And the stars are dim and far,
We can see thy holy purpose
In the glimm’ring of a star,
And we feel thy loving presence
In the gentle, silent air.
For the strength of the hills we bless thee,
Our God, our fathers’ God.

36.title: They, the Builders of the Nation
lines: 1: They, the builders of the nation,
Blazing trails along the way;
Stepping-stones for generations
Were their deeds of every day.
Building new and firm foundations,
Pushing on the wild frontier,
Forging onward, ever onward,
Blessed, honored Pioneer!
2: In the wilderness they chanted:
“We are on our journey home.”
Songs of Zion, sweetly chanted,
Cheered their hearts and hurried them on.
Faith was in their hearts, implanted
By the word of God so clear.
Forward, pressing ever forward,
Blessed, honored Pioneer!
3: As they toiled, they followed after
Him who knows the path ahead.
’Mid the tears and ’mid the laughter,
He, their true companion, led.
In their hearts there was no question;
In their minds there was no fear.
Onward, ever, ever onward,
Blessed, honored Pioneer!

37.title: The Wintry Day, Descending to Its Close
lines: 1: The wintry day, descending to its close,
Bids us all seek for rest and sweet repose,
While round our homes the chilling breezes blow,
And all the land is mantled o’er with snow.
2: O God, our Father, we thy children bow,
In deep humility, before thee now.
We thank thee for thy care the livelong day,
That thou didst guard us from the evil way.
3: For thou hast given us blessings rich and free—
A home, and friends, and loving family,
The holy gospel, with its saving light,
To guide us through the darkness of the night.
4: And now, as we retire to our rest,
We pray that thou wilt make us truly blest.
Let thy good Spirit in our bosoms dwell,
That we with thee may ever feel it well.

38.title: Come, All Ye Saints of Zion
lines: 1: Come, all ye Saints of Zion,
And let us praise the Lord;
His goodness and his mercy
Let us with joy record.
He’s brought us from the nations,
And from the isles afar;
He’s gathered us together,
A people for his war.
2: The Lord has been our helper,
The Lord has been our guide;
He’s given us a prophet,
And what could we ask beside?
He’s given us a temple,
And ordinances there,
That we may be exalted,
And his full glory share.

39.title: O Saints of Zion
lines: 1: O Saints of Zion, don’t you fear;
The Lord your God is with you here.
He will protect you with his hand
And give to you the promised land.
2: The wicked will not long prevail;
Their pomp and power soon will fail.
The Saints will see their overthrow
And Zion’s cause in triumph go.

40.title: Arise, O Glorious Zion
lines: 1: Arise, O glorious Zion,
Thou joy of latter days,
Whom nations shall rely on
And celebrate thy praise.
Arise and shine in splendor,
And with thy beauty crowned,
Thy borders wide extended,
Thy name shall fill the world.
2: The streams of living water
From thy pure fountains flow,
To thee each son and daughter
In joyful haste shall go.
Thy temple, on its station,
Shall be the nations’ light,
And for a great salvation,
A standard and a might.

41.title: Let Zion in Her Beauty Rise
lines: 1: Let Zion in her beauty rise;
Her light begins to shine.
Ere long her King will rend the skies,
Majestic and divine.
The gospel’s spreading far and wide;
The Gentile race comes in;
And Israel, scattered far and wide,
Are turning from their sin.
2: The Spirit’s pow’r is poured on all,
And visions fly abroad.
The day of vengeance is at hand,
The coming of the Lord.
The nations hear the solemn sound;
The truth is breaking forth;
The Saints in every land are found,
From east to west and north.

42.title: Hail to the Brightness of Zion's Glad Morning!
42.safe_title: Hail to the Brightness of Zions Glad Morning!
lines: 1: Hail to the brightness of Zion’s glad morning!
Joy to the lands that in darkness have lain!
Hushed be the accents of sorrow and mourning;
Zion in triumph begins her mild reign.
Hail to the brightness of Zion’s glad morning,
Long by the prophets of Israel foretold!
Hail to the millions from bondage returning!
Gentiles and Jews the blest vision behold.
2: Lo, in the desert the rich flowers are springing;
Streams ever copious are gliding along.
Loud from the mountain-tops echoes are ringing;
Wastes rise in verdure and mingle in song.
Hark! from all lands, from the isles of the ocean,
Praise to Jehovah in fullness ascends.
Fanned by the winds that bear news of salvation,
Truth’s holy banner, in triumph, extends.

43.title: Zion Stands with Hills Surrounded
lines: 1: Zion stands with hills surrounded—
Zion, kept by pow’r divine.
All her foes shall be confounded,
Though the world in arms combine.
Happy Zion, happy Zion,
What a favored lot is thine!
2: Ev’ry human tie may perish;
Friend to friend unfaithful prove;
Mothers cease their own to cherish;
Heav’n and earth at last remove.
But no changes, but no changes,
Can attend Jehovah’s love.
3: In the furnace God may prove thee,
Thence to bring thee forth more bright,
But can never cease to love thee;
Thou art precious in his sight.
God is with thee, God is with thee;
Thou shalt triumph in his might.

44.title: Beautiful Zion, Built Above
lines: 1: Beautiful Zion, built above,
Beautiful city that I love,
Beautiful gates of pearly white,
Beautiful temple—God its light!
He who was slain on Calvary
Opens those pearly gates for me.
2: Beautiful heav’n, where all is light,
Beautiful angels clothed in white,
Beautiful strains that never tire,
Beautiful harps through all the choir;
There shall I join the chorus sweet,
Worshipping at the Savior’s feet.
3: Beautiful crowns on every brow,
Beautiful palms the conquerors show,
Beautiful robes the ransomed wear,
Beautiful all who enter there;
Thither I press with eager feet;
There shall my rest be long and sweet.

45.title: Lead Me into Life Eternal
lines: 1: Lead me into life eternal
By the gospel’s holy call.
Let me be among the faithful
Who shall conquer over all.
Let me be among the righteous
Who have kept the faith and died,
That with them I may be worthy
Ever with thee to abide.

46.title: Glorious Things of Thee Are Spoken
lines: 1: Glorious things of thee are spoken,
Zion, city of our God!
He whose word cannot be broken
Formed thee for his own abode.
On the Rock of Ages founded,
What can shake thy sure repose?
With salvation’s walls surrounded,
Thou mayst smile at all thy foes.
2: See, the streams of living waters,
Springing from eternal love,
Well supply thy sons and daughters
And all fear of want remove.
Who can faint while such a river
Ever flows their thirst t’assuage—
Grace which, like the Lord, the Giver,
Never fails from age to age?
3: Round each habitation hov’ring,
See the cloud and fire appear
For a glory and a cov’ring,
Showing that the Lord is near.
Thus deriving from their banner
Light by night and shade by day,
Safe they feed upon the manna
Which he gives them when they pray.

47.title: We Will Sing of Zion
lines: 1: We will sing of Zion,
City of our God,
Where the Saints will gather
From all lands abroad,
Where the pure in heart will
Ever love to be,
And the Lord will show his
Face for them to see.
2: Zion will be glorious,
Beautiful and bright;
God will be her glory
And her endless light.
Then let us be faithful,
And we shall be blest,
And with all the righteous
Find a peaceful rest.

48.title: Glorious Things Are Sung of Zion
lines: 1: Glorious things are sung of Zion,
Enoch’s city seen of old,
Where the righteous are assembled,
Gathered in one happy fold,
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest,
And the humble, meek, and lowly
Are with peace and plenty blest.
2: In the new and glorious city,
Christ, our Lord, will ever be;
He will be their King and Savior,
And his face they’ll ever see.
Then let us be pure and holy,
That we may be sanctified,
And be found among the ransomed,
And with Jesus Christ abide.

49.title: Adam-ondi-Ahman
lines: 1: This earth was once a garden place,
With all her glories common,
And men did live a holy race,
And worship Jesus face to face,
In Adam-ondi-Ahman.
2: We read that Enoch walked with God,
Above the pow’r of mammon,
While Zion spread herself abroad,
And Saints and angels sang aloud
In Adam-ondi-Ahman.
3: Her land was good and greatly blest,
Beyond old Israel’s Canaan;
Her fame was known from east to west;
Her peace was great, and pure the rest
Of Adam-ondi-Ahman.
4: Hosanna to such days to come—
The Savior’s second comin’—
When all the Saints who wander home,
With shouts of joy, will overcome
In Adam-ondi-Ahman.

50.title: Come, Thou Glorious Day of Promise
lines: 1: Come, thou glorious day of promise,
Come and spread thy cheerful ray,
When the scattered sheep of Israel
Shall no longer go astray,
When the trumpet shall be sounded,
And the slumbering saints shall rise,
And the King of glory, coming,
Shall descend from yonder skies.
2: Come, thou glorious day of promise,
When the pris’ner shall be free,
And the haughty, proud oppressor
Shall in chains of bondage be,
When the righteous shall be gathered
From the corners of the earth,
And shall sing the songs of Zion
With a new, celestial birth.

51.title: Sons of Michael, He Approaches
lines: 1: Sons of Michael, he approaches!
Rise; the Eternal Father greet.
Bow, ye thousands, low before him;
Minister before his feet.
Hail the Patriarchs of Zion!
And the Prophets of our God,
As they come to bless the righteous
And to rule with iron rod.
2: Sons of Michael, he approaches!
Let the trumpet loudly sound.
Greet your blessed elder brother;
Let his praise the earth resound.
Hail the day of earth’s redemption,
When the Savior comes to reign!
Millions, then, will be his subjects,
And will praise his holy name.

52.title: The Day Dawn Is Breaking
lines: 1: The day dawn is breaking, the world is awaking;
The clouds of night’s darkness are fleeing away.
The sunlight is gilding the vales and the mountains;
The shadows of midnight are vanished and gone.
2: Rejoice, all ye Saints, for the kingdom of heaven,
Established on earth, shall forever remain.
The Lord will protect it and be its defender;
His pow’r and his glory will ever sustain.
3: The day dawn is breaking, the world is awaking;
The clouds of night’s darkness are fleeing away.
The sunlight is gilding the vales and the mountains;
The shadows of midnight are vanished and gone.
4: The ensign of Zion is waving in beauty,
A light to the nations, a joy to the world.
Let truth spread its banner and fill every nation,
Till peace reigns triumphant and love is unfurled.

53.title: Let Earth's Inhabitants Rejoice
lines: 1: Let earth’s inhabitants rejoice
And gladly hail the glorious hour.
Again is heard a prophet’s voice
That speaks with God’s own mighty pow’r.
2: Rejoice! for God has sent his Son
To earth in these the latter days,
That men might turn from ev’ry wrong
And walk in truth and righteousness.
3: Rejoice! the Book of Mormon, sealed,
Is now by God’s command revealed.
Its sacred truths are brought to light,
Dispelling darkness with their might.
4: Rejoice! for God doth condescend
His holy gospel to defend.
His mighty arm will bear us on,
Till we the vict’ry shall have won.

54.title: Behold, the Mountain of the Lord
lines: 1: Behold, the mountain of the Lord
In latter days shall rise
On mountain tops, above the hills,
And draw the wond’ring eyes.
2: To this the joyful nations round,
All tribes and tongues, shall flow;
“Up to the hill of God,” they’ll say,
“And to his house we’ll go.”
3: The beam that shines from Zion’s hill
Shall lighten every land;
The King who reigns in Salem’s tow’rs
Shall all the world command.

55.title: Lo, the Mighty God Appearing!
lines: 1: Lo, the mighty God appearing!
From on high Jehovah speaks.
Eastern lands the summons hearing;
O’er the west the glory breaks.
Onward goes the proclamation:
Cease from sin and turn to God;
Heed the final dispensation,
Ere he sends his chast’ning rod.
2: Now the world is filled with sorrow,
Grief and anguish, woe and pain;
All the earth is in commotion;
Clouds of darkness spread amain.
Kingdoms crumble into ruin;
Palaces and temples fall;
Plague and pestilence are strewing
Death and darkness over all.
3: Zion’s standard now is waving;
Look aloft! its light behold.
All the Saints, their trials braving,
To the gospel are enrolled.
Now the day of grace is shining;
Saints, your lamps well-trimmed must be.
See the signs of Jesus’ coming;
Haste to meet him joyfully.

56.title: Softly Beams the Sacred Dawning
lines: 1: Softly beams the sacred dawning
Of the great millennial day;
And the kingly Prophet’s coming
Now is near and speeds its way.
Ch: Haste, O haste, the day of glory,
When the Savior comes again,
When the Saints shall tell the story,
“Christ, the Lord, has come to reign.”
2: Zion’s walls shall be extended;
God will gather in his own;
And the reign of sin be ended,
Jesus take the royal throne.
Ch: Haste, O haste, the day of glory,
When the Savior comes again,
When the Saints shall tell the story,
“Christ, the Lord, has come to reign.”
3: Then shall cease the sounds of weeping,
And the suff’ring of the poor;
And the saints, in Christ now sleeping,
Shall arise to die no more.
Ch: Haste, O haste, the day of glory,
When the Savior comes again,
When the Saints shall tell the story,
“Christ, the Lord, has come to reign.”

57.title: We're Not Ashamed to Own Our Lord
57.safe_title: Were Not Ashamed to Own Our Lord
lines: 1: We’re not ashamed to own our Lord,
And worship him on earth.
We love to learn his holy word,
And know what souls are worth.
2: When Jesus comes in burning flame,
Then we shall see his face;
And we who love and fear his name
Shall triumph in his grace.

58.title: Come, Ye Children of the Lord
lines: 1: Come, ye children of the Lord,
Let us sing with one accord.
Let us raise a joyful strain
To our Lord who soon will reign.
He will come and not be slow.
Let us all a-shouting go.
We will leave this world of sin;
In his kingdom enter in.
2: Then we’ll sing the song of praise,
And we’ll shout in joyful lays,
“Glory, honor to our King!
Hallelujahs we will sing!”
Come, ye children of the Lord,
Let us sing with one accord.
Let us raise a joyful strain
To our Lord who soon will reign.

59.title: Come, O Thou King of Kings
lines: 1: Come, O thou King of Kings!
We’ve waited long for thee,
With healing in thy wings,
To set thy people free.
Come, thou Desire of nations, come;
Let Israel now be gathered home.
2: Come, all ye nations, come,
To Zion’s holy mount,
Where all the Saints have come,
And found the living fount.
Come, for the time is now at hand
To leave your homes and native land.
3: Hark! for the angels’ trump
Is sounding far and near,
And all the Saints shall jump
For joy, their Lord to hear.
Come, for the bridegroom is at hand;
Go forth to meet him, all the land.

60.title: Battle Hymn of the Republic
lines: 1: Mine eye hath seen the glory of the coming of the Lord;
He is trampling out the vintage where the grapes of wrath are stored;
He hath loosed the fateful lightning of his terrible swift sword;
His truth is marching on.
Ch: Glory, glory, hallelujah!
Glory, glory, hallelujah!
Glory, glory, hallelujah!
His truth is marching on.
2: I have seen him in the watch-fires of a hundred circling camps;
They have builded him an altar in the evening dews and damps;
I can read his righteous sentence by the dim and flaring lamps;
His day is marching on.
Ch: Glory, glory, hallelujah!
Glory, glory, hallelujah!
Glory, glory, hallelujah!
His truth is marching on.
3: He has sounded forth the trumpet that shall never call retreat;
He is sifting out the hearts of men before his judgment seat;
Oh, be swift, my soul, to answer him! Be jubilant, my feet!
Our God is marching on.
Ch: Glory, glory, hallelujah!
Glory, glory, hallelujah!
Glory, glory, hallelujah!
His truth is marching on.

61.title: Raise Your Voices to the Lord
lines: 1: Raise your voices to the Lord,
And with praises him adore.
Sing his pow’r and his might;
Let your songs to him take flight.
Let your voices blend in one,
In devotion to his Son,
For the blessings he doth give,
That his children all may live.
2: Let us praise his holy name;
To the world his love proclaim.
Tell the story of his grace,
That in heav’n we have a place.
Let our songs of praise ascend,
To our Father and our Friend,
For the joy he doth impart
To the meek and contrite heart.

62.title: All Creatures of Our God and King
lines: 1: All creatures of our God and King,
Lift up your voice and with us sing,
Alleluia! Alleluia!
Thou burning sun with golden beam,
Thou silver moon with softer gleam!
O praise him! O praise him!
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
2: Thou rushing wind that art so strong,
Ye clouds that sail in heav’n along,
O praise him! Alleluia!
Thou rising morn, in praise rejoice,
Ye lights of evening, find a voice!
O praise him! O praise him!
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
3: And all ye men of tender heart,
Forgiving others, take your part,
O sing ye! Alleluia!
Ye who long pain and sorrow bear,
Praise God and on him cast your care!
O praise him! O praise him!
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
4: Let all things their Creator bless,
And worship him in humbleness,
O praise him! Alleluia!
Praise, praise the Father, praise the Son,
And praise the Spirit, Three in One!
O praise him! O praise him!
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

63.title: Great King of Heaven
lines: 1: Great King of heaven, our hearts we raise,
To thee our thankful songs of praise,
For all thy mercies, rich and free,
That thou art pouring down on me.
2: Thou art our Father, and we thy sons,
And as the moments, days, and months have run,
Thy gentle hand hath led us on,
And by thy bounty we are fed and clothed.

64.title: On This Day of Joy and Gladness
lines: 1: On this day of joy and gladness,
Lord, we praise thy holy name;
And with songs of adoration,
We thy wondrous love proclaim.
For the gospel of salvation,
For its bright and shining ray,
For the hope that’s set before us,
We will praise thy name today.
2: For the prophet thou hast sent us,
For his words of truth and light,
For the priesthood thou hast giv’n us,
For its power and its might,
For the blessings of the Spirit,
For its guidance and its stay,
For the hope of life eternal,
We will praise thy name today.

65.title: Come, All Ye Saints Who Dwell on Earth
lines: 1: Come, all ye Saints who dwell on earth,
Your cheerful voices raise,
And let your songs of praise and mirth
Resound in joyful lays.
The Lord has been your constant friend;
His pow’r has set you free.
He will your righteous cause defend
And give you liberty.
2: Then let your songs of praise arise
Unto the God of heav’n,
Who hears your prayers and your cries,
And has this blessing giv’n.
Let songs of joy and gladness flow,
And shouts of triumph rise.
Let all the Saints on earth below
Unite with those on high.

66.title: Rejoice, the Lord Is King!
lines: 1: Rejoice, the Lord is King!
Your Lord and King adore!
Rejoice, give thanks, and sing,
And triumph evermore.
Ch: Lift up your heart,
Lift up your voice!
Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!
2: Jesus the Savior reigns,
The God of truth and love.
When he had purged our stains,
He took his seat above.
Ch: Lift up your heart,
Lift up your voice!
Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!
3: His kingdom cannot fail;
He rules o’er earth and heav’n.
The keys of death and hell
Are to our Jesus giv’n.
Ch: Lift up your heart,
Lift up your voice!
Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!
4: Rejoice in glorious hope!
Our Lord, the Judge, shall come
And take his servants up
To their eternal home.
Ch: Lift up your heart,
Lift up your voice!
Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!

67.title: Glory to God on High
lines: 1: Glory to God on high!
Let heav’n and earth reply,
“Praise ye his name!”
His love and grace adore,
Who all our sorrows bore;
And sing forevermore,
“Worthy the Lamb!”
2: While they around the throne
Cheerfully join in one,
Praising his name,
Ye who have felt his blood,
Sealing your peace with God,
Sound his dear name abroad:
“Worthy the Lamb!”
3: Join, all ye ransomed race,
Our Lord and God to bless;
Praise ye his name!
In him we will rejoice,
And make a joyful noise,
Shouting with heart and voice,
“Worthy the Lamb!”
4: Soon must we change our place;
Yet will we never cease
Praising his name.
To him our songs we’ll bring,
Hail him our gracious King,
And through all ages sing,
“Worthy the Lamb!”

68.title: A Mighty Fortress Is Our God
lines: 1: A mighty fortress is our God,
A bulwark never failing;
Our helper he, amid the flood
Of mortal ills prevailing.
For still our ancient foe
Doth seek to work us woe;
His craft and pow’r are great,
And, armed with cruel hate,
On earth is not his equal.
2: Did we in our own strength confide,
Our striving would be losing,
Were not the right man on our side,
The man of God’s own choosing.
Dost ask who that may be?
Christ Jesus, it is he;
Lord Sabaoth his name,
From age to age the same;
And he must win the battle.
3: And though this world, with devils filled,
Should threaten to undo us,
We will not fear, for God hath willed
His truth to triumph through us.
The prince of darkness grim,
We tremble not for him;
His rage we can endure,
For lo, his doom is sure;
One little word shall fell him.
4: That word above all earthly pow’rs,
No thanks to them, abideth;
The Spirit and the gifts are ours
Through him who with us sideth.
Let goods and kindred go,
This mortal life also;
The body they may kill;
God’s truth abideth still;
His kingdom is forever.

69.title: All Glory, Laud, and Honor
lines: 1: All glory, laud, and honor
To thee, Redeemer, King,
To whom the lips of children
Made sweet hosannas ring.
Thou art the King of Israel,
Thou David’s royal Son,
Who in the Lord’s name comest,
The King and Blessed One.
2: The company of angels
Are praising thee on high,
And mortal men and all things
Created make reply.
The people of the Hebrews
With palms before thee went;
Our praise and prayer and anthems
Before thee we present.
3: To thee, before thy passion,
They sang their hymns of praise;
To thee, now high exalted,
Our melody we raise.
Thou didst accept their praises;
Accept the praise we bring,
Who in all good delightest,
Thou good and gracious King.

70.title: Sing Praise to Him
lines: 1: Sing praise to him who reigns above,
The Lord of all creation,
The source of life and truth and love,
The rock of our salvation.
His mercy still, his grace so free,
No mortal tongue can measure;
His word is truth eternally,
His promise is our treasure.
2: Sing praise to him, the Lord of light,
Whose glory shines in splendor,
Who rules the day, who rules the night,
The universe’s defender.
He leads his people by his hand;
His arm is their protection.
His word goes forth from land to land,
To call them to perfection.

71.title: With Songs of Praise
lines: 1: With songs of praise we come to thee,
Our Father and our God,
And with our hearts we worship thee,
And bow before thy rod.
We thank thee for the gospel light,
That shines with heav’nly ray;
We thank thee for the Spirit’s might,
To guide us in thy way.
2: We thank thee for the prophet’s voice,
To guide us in our youth;
We thank thee for the blessed choice
To know eternal truth.
We thank thee for our parents dear,
Who teach us to obey;
We thank thee for our friends so near,
To cheer us on our way.

72.title: Praise to the Lord, the Almighty
lines: 1: Praise to the Lord, the Almighty, the King of creation!
O my soul, praise him, for he is thy health and salvation!
All ye who hear,
Now to his temple draw near;
Join me in glad adoration!
2: Praise to the Lord, who o’er all things so wondrously reigneth,
Shelters thee under his wings, yea, so gently sustaineth!
Hast thou not seen
How thy desires e’er have been
Granted in what he ordaineth?
3: Praise to the Lord, who doth prosper thy work and defend thee;
Surely his goodness and mercy here daily attend thee.
Ponder anew
What the Almighty can do,
If with his love he befriend thee.
4: Praise to the Lord! Oh, let all that is in me adore him!
All that hath life and breath, come now with praises before him!
Let the amen
Sound from his people again;
Gladly for aye we adore him.

73.title: Praise the Lord with Heart and Voice
lines: 1: Praise the Lord with heart and voice;
With his saints we now rejoice.
Sing his praise, ye sons of men;
Glory, glory, sing again.
Let your songs of praise arise;
Let them reach beyond the skies.
Praise his name in joyful lays;
Sound his fame in endless praise.

74.title: Praise Ye the Lord
lines: 1: Praise ye the Lord! ’Tis good to raise
Your hearts and voices in his praise.
His nature and his works invite
To make this duty our delight.
2: He formed the stars, those heav’nly flames;
He counts their numbers, calls their names.
His wisdom’s vast, and knows no bound,
A deep where all our thoughts are drowned.
3: Sing to the Lord, exalt him high,
Who spreads his clouds all o’er the sky.
There he prepares the fruitful rain,
Nor lets the drops descend in vain.
4: He makes the grass the hills adorn,
And clothes the smiling fields with corn.
The beasts with food his hands supply,
And the young ravens when they cry.

75.title: In Hymns of Praise
lines: 1: In hymns of praise, let us combine
To laud the attributes divine,
And to the sacred courts of God
Proclaim his boundless love abroad.
2: Let all who in his temple meet,
With rev’rence bow before his feet,
And with united voice and heart,
Perform their consecrated part.

76.title: God of Our Fathers, We Come unto Thee
lines: 1: God of our fathers, we come unto thee,
On this the day of our jubilee.
We have been blessed with thy goodness and might,
Thou hast preserved us by day and by night.
We are thy children, and thou art our God;
Thou hast redeemed us with thy precious blood.
2: God of our fathers, we come unto thee,
Lifting our voices in song unto thee.
We have been blessed with the gospel of light,
Thou hast preserved us by thy holy might.
We are thy children, and thou art our King;
Thou hast redeemed us, thy praises we sing.

77.title: Great Is the Lord
lines: 1: Great is the Lord; ’tis good to praise
His high and holy name.
Well may the saints in latter days
His wondrous love proclaim.
2: To him let endless praise be given,
Who reigns in worlds of light,
Who with a word just spake from heaven,
And all things sprung to sight.
3: By his own power the planets roll,
In order and in time,
And from the north to south-most pole,
They show his skill divine.
4: Great is the Lord; ’tis good to praise
His high and holy name.
Well may the saints in latter days
His wondrous love proclaim.

78.title: God of Our Fathers, Whose Almighty Hand
lines: 1: God of our fathers, whose almighty hand
Leads forth in beauty all the starry band
Of shining worlds in splendor through the skies,
Our grateful songs before thy throne arise.
2: Thy love divine hath led us in the past;
In this free land by thee our lot is cast;
Be thou our ruler, guardian, guide, and stay,
Thy word our law, thy paths our chosen way.
3: From war’s alarms, from deadly pestilence,
Be thy strong arm our ever sure defense;
Thy true religion in our hearts increase;
Thy bounteous goodness nourish us in peace.
4: Refresh thy people on their toilsome way;
Lead us from night to never-ending day;
Fill all our lives with love and grace divine,
And glory, laud, and praise be ever thine.

79.title: With All the Power of Heart and Tongue
lines: 1: With all the power of heart and tongue,
I’ll praise my Maker in my song.
Angels shall hear the notes I raise,
Approve the song, and join the praise.
2: To God I cried when troubles rose.
He heard me and subdued my foes.
He did my rising fears control
And strength diffused through all my soul.
3: Amid a thousand snares I stand,
Upheld and guarded by thy hand.
Thy words my fainting soul revive
And keep my dying faith alive.

80.title: God of Our Fathers, Known of Old
lines: 1: God of our fathers, known of old,
Lord of our far-flung battle line,
Beneath whose awful hand we hold
Dominion over palm and pine:
Lord God of Hosts, be with us yet,
Lest we forget, lest we forget.
2: The tumult and the shouting dies;
The captains and the kings depart.
Still stands thine ancient sacrifice,
An humble and a contrite heart.
Lord God of Hosts, be with us yet,
Lest we forget, lest we forget.
3: Far-called, our navies melt away;
On dune and headland sinks the fire.
Lo, all our pomp of yesterday
Is one with Nineveh and Tyre!
Judge of the Nations, spare us yet,
Lest we forget, lest we forget.
4: If, drunk with sight of power, we loose
Wild tongues that have not thee in awe,
Such boastings as the Gentiles use,
Or lesser breeds without the law:
Lord God of Hosts, be with us yet,
Lest we forget, lest we forget.
5: For heathen heart that puts her trust
In reeking tube and iron shard,
All valiant dust that builds on dust,
And guarding, calls not thee to guard:
For frantic boast and foolish word,
Thy mercy on thy people, Lord.

81.title: Press Forward, Saints
lines: 1: Press forward, Saints, with steadfast faith in Christ,
With hope’s bright flame aglow in heart and mind,
With love of God and love of all mankind.
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
2: Press forward, feasting on the word of Christ,
Receive ye his image in your countenance,
And in his sacred name with thanks rejoice.
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
3: Press forward, ever in the name of Christ,
The Living Son of our eternal God,
And ever strive to do the will of God.
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

82.title: For All the Saints
lines: 1: For all the saints who from their labors rest,
Who thee by faith before the world confessed,
Thy name, O Jesus, be forever blest.
Alleluia! Alleluia!
2: Thou wast their rock, their fortress, and their might;
Thou, Lord, their Captain in the well-fought fight;
Thou, in the darkness drear, their one true light.
Alleluia! Alleluia!
3: Oh, may thy soldiers, faithful, true, and bold,
Fight as the saints who nobly fought of old
And win with them the victor’s crown of gold.
Alleluia! Alleluia!
4: From earth’s wide bounds, from ocean’s farthest coast,
Through gates of pearl streams in the countless host,
Singing to Father, Son, and Holy Ghost:
Alleluia! Alleluia!

83.title: Guide Us, O Thou Great Jehovah
lines: 1: Guide us, O thou great Jehovah,
Lead us to the promised land.
We are weak, but thou art able;
Hold us with thy pow’rful hand.
Holy Spirit, Holy Spirit,
Feed us till the Savior comes,
Feed us till the Savior comes.
2: Open, Jesus, Zion’s portals;
Let us enter and rejoice.
Bid our fears and doubts be silent;
Bid us hear thy gracious voice.
Holy Spirit, Holy Spirit,
Feed us till the Savior comes,
Feed us till the Savior comes.

84.title: Faith of Our Fathers
lines: 1: Faith of our fathers, living still,
In spite of dungeon, fire, and sword;
Oh, how our hearts beat high with joy
Whene’er we hear that glorious word!
Ch: Faith of our fathers, holy faith!
We will be true to thee till death.
2: Faith of our fathers, we will strive
To win all nations unto thee;
And through the truth that comes from God,
Mankind shall then be truly free.
Ch: Faith of our fathers, holy faith!
We will be true to thee till death.
3: Faith of our fathers, we will love
Both friend and foe in all our strife,
And preach thee, too, as love knows how,
By kindly words and virtuous life.
Ch: Faith of our fathers, holy faith!
We will be true to thee till death.

85.title: How Firm a Foundation
lines: 1: How firm a foundation, ye Saints of the Lord,
Is laid for your faith in his excellent word!
What more can he say than to you he hath said,
Who unto the Savior for refuge have fled?
2: In ev’ry condition, in sickness, in health,
In poverty’s vale or abounding in wealth,
At home or abroad, on the land or the sea,
As thy days may demand, so thy succor shall be.
3: Fear not, I am with thee; oh, be not dismayed,
For I am thy God and will still give thee aid.
I’ll strengthen thee, help thee, and cause thee to stand,
Upheld by my righteous, omnipotent hand.
4: When through the deep waters I call thee to go,
The rivers of sorrow shall not thee o’erflow,
For I will be with thee, thy troubles to bless,
And sanctify to thee thy deepest distress.
5: When through fiery trials thy pathway shall lie,
My grace, all-sufficient, shall be thy supply.
The flame shall not hurt thee; I only design
Thy dross to consume and thy gold to refine.
6: E’en down to old age all my people shall prove
My sov’reign, eternal, unchangeable love;
And when hoary hairs shall their temples adorn,
Like lambs they shall still in my bosom be borne.
7: The soul that on Jesus hath leaned for repose
I will not, I cannot, desert to his foes;
That soul, though all hell should endeavor to shake,
I’ll never, no, never, no, never forsake!

86.title: How Great Thou Art
lines: 1: O Lord my God, when I in awesome wonder
Consider all the worlds thy hands have made,
I see the stars, I hear the rolling thunder,
Thy pow’r throughout the universe displayed.
Ch: Then sings my soul, my Savior God, to thee,
How great thou art, how great thou art!
Then sings my soul, my Savior God, to thee,
How great thou art, how great thou art!
2: When through the woods and forest glades I wander
And hear the birds sing sweetly in the trees,
When I look down from lofty mountain grandeur
And hear the brook and feel the gentle breeze,
Ch: Then sings my soul, my Savior God, to thee,
How great thou art, how great thou art!
Then sings my soul, my Savior God, to thee,
How great thou art, how great thou art!
3: And when I think that God, his Son not sparing,
Sent him to die, I scarce can take it in,
That on the cross, my burden gladly bearing,
He bled and died to take away my sin,
Ch: Then sings my soul, my Savior God, to thee,
How great thou art, how great thou art!
Then sings my soul, my Savior God, to thee,
How great thou art, how great thou art!
4: When Christ shall come with shout of acclamation
And take me home, what joy shall fill my heart!
Then I shall bow in humble adoration
And there proclaim, my God, how great thou art!
Ch: Then sings my soul, my Savior God, to thee,
How great thou art, how great thou art!
Then sings my soul, my Savior God, to thee,
How great thou art, how great thou art!

87.title: God Is Love
lines: 1: God is love; his mercy brightens
All the path in which we rove;
Bliss he wakes and woe he lightens;
God is wisdom, God is love.
2: Chance and change are busy ever;
Man decays, and ages move;
But his mercy waneth never;
God is wisdom, God is love.
3: E’en the hour that darkest seemeth
Will his changeless goodness prove;
From the gloom his brightness streameth;
God is wisdom, God is love.

88.title: Great God, Attend While Zion Sings
lines: 1: Great God, attend while Zion sings
The joy that from thy presence springs.
To spend one day with thee on earth
Exceeds a thousand days of mirth.
2: Might I enjoy the meanest place
Within thy house, O God of grace,
Not tents of ease, nor thrones of pow’r,
Should tempt my feet to leave thy door.
3: God is our sun, he makes our day;
God is our shield, he guards our way.
All needful grace he will bestow
And crown with bliss our lives below.
4: O God our King, whose sov’reign sway
The glorious hosts of heav’n obey,
And devils dread thine awful frown,
And saints rejoice to see thy crown!

89.title: The Lord Is My Light
lines: 1: The Lord is my light; then why should I fear?
By day and by night his presence is near.
He is my salvation from sorrow and sin;
This blessed assurance the Spirit doth bring.
Ch: The Lord is my light; he is my joy.
He is my song in the night.
The Lord is my light; he is my joy.
He is my song in the night.
2: The Lord is my light; though clouds may arise,
Faith, stronger than sight, looks up through the skies,
Where Jesus forever in glory doth reign.
Then how can I ever in darkness remain?
Ch: The Lord is my light; he is my joy.
He is my song in the night.
The Lord is my light; he is my joy.
He is my song in the night.
3: The Lord is my light; the Lord is my strength.
I know in his might I’ll conquer at length.
My weakness in mercy he covers with pow’r,
And, walking by faith, I am blest every hour.
Ch: The Lord is my light; he is my joy.
He is my song in the night.
The Lord is my light; he is my joy.
He is my song in the night.

90.title: From All That Dwell below the Skies
lines: 1: From all that dwell below the skies
Let the Creator’s praise arise;
Let the Redeemer’s name be sung
Through ev’ry land, by ev’ry tongue.
2: Eternal are thy mercies, Lord;
Eternal truth attends thy word.
Thy praise shall sound from shore to shore
Till suns shall rise and set no more.

91.title: Father, Thy Children to Thee Now Raise
lines: 1: Father, thy children to thee now raise
Their voices in a song of praise.
We thank thee for our home so dear
And for our friends, both far and near.
2: We thank thee for the sunny light,
For moon and stars that shine at night,
For gentle rain and pure white snow,
For flow’rs that in the garden grow.
3: We thank thee for our daily food,
For all things that are kind and good.
Help us to be like thee, we pray,
And grow more loving ev’ry day.

92.title: For the Beauty of the Earth
lines: 1: For the beauty of the earth,
For the beauty of the skies,
For the love which from our birth
Over and around us lies,
Ch: Lord of all, to thee we raise
This our hymn of grateful praise.
2: For the beauty of each hour
Of the day and of the night,
Hill and vale, and tree and flow’r,
Sun and moon, and stars of light,
Ch: Lord of all, to thee we raise
This our hymn of grateful praise.
3: For the joy of human love,
Brother, sister, parent, child,
Friends on earth, and friends above,
For all gentle thoughts and mild,
Ch: Lord of all, to thee we raise
This our hymn of grateful praise.
4: For the gift of thy dear Son,
For the hope of heaven above,
For the victory he has won,
And for all his wondrous love,
Ch: Lord of all, to thee we raise
This our hymn of grateful praise.

93.title: Prayer of Thanksgiving
lines: 1: We thank thee, O God, for the blessings of light,
For the sun of the morning and stars of the night,
For the dew on the meadows, the rain on the hills,
The breeze in the treetops, the music of rills.
2: We thank thee for love and the kindness of friends,
For the joy that their presence so graciously lends,
For all the sweet memories treasured and dear,
For the ties that unite us to those we hold here.
3: We thank thee for work and the strength to perform,
For the struggle and effort, the calm and the storm,
For the trials that test us, the burdens we bear,
For the sweetness of slumber, forgetting all care.
4: We thank thee for life and its marvelous gift,
For the soul and the spirit our minds to uplift.
We thank thee for Jesus, our brother and friend,
And the promise of glory and life without end.

94.title: Come, Ye Thankful People
lines: 1: Come, ye thankful people, come;
Raise the song of harvest home.
All is safely gathered in,
Ere the winter storms begin.
God, our Maker, doth provide
For our wants to be supplied.
Come to God’s own temple, come;
Raise the song of harvest home.
2: All the world is God’s own field,
Fruit unto his praise to yield;
Wheat and tares together sown,
Unto joy or sorrow grown.
First the blade and then the ear,
Then the full corn shall appear.
Lord of harvest, grant that we
Wholesome grain and pure may be.
3: For the Lord our God shall come,
And shall take his harvest home.
From his field shall in that day
All offenses purge away,
Giving angels charge at last
In the fire the tares to cast,
But the fruitful ears to store
In his garner evermore.
4: Even so, Lord, quickly come
To thy final harvest home.
Gather thou thy people in,
Free from sorrow, free from sin,
There, forever purified,
In thy presence to abide:
Come, with all thine angels, come;
Raise the glorious harvest home.

95.title: Now Thank We All Our God
lines: 1: Now thank we all our God
With heart and hands and voices,
Who wondrous things hath done,
In whom his world rejoices;
Who from our mothers’ arms
Hath blessed us on our way
With countless gifts of love,
And still is ours today.
2: Oh, may this bounteous God
Through all our life be near us,
With ever joyful hearts
And blessed peace to cheer us
And keep us in his grace,
And guide us when perplexed,
And free us from all ills
In this world and the next.
3: All praise and thanks to God
The Father now be given,
The Son, and him who reigns
With them in highest heaven,
The one eternal God,
Whom earth and heav’n adore;
For thus it was, is now,
And shall be evermore.

96.title: Dearest Children, God Is Near You
lines: 1: Dearest children, God is near you,
Watching o’er you day and night,
And delights to own and bless you,
If you strive to do what’s right.
He will bless you, he will bless you,
If you put your trust in him.
2: Dearest children, holy angels
Watch your actions and record;
And they weep when you do evil,
And rejoice when you do good.
Serve the Savior, serve the Savior,
And you’ll have the angels’ love.
3: Come then, children, come to Jesus;
He has said you may be his.
He will guard you and protect you,
And will take you home to bliss.
Praise the Savior, praise the Savior,
Praise him for his boundless love.

97.title: Lead, Kindly Light
lines: 1: Lead, kindly Light, amid th’encircling gloom;
Lead thou me on!
The night is dark, and I am far from home;
Lead thou me on!
Keep thou my feet; I do not ask to see
The distant scene—one step enough for me.
2: I was not ever thus, nor prayed that thou
Shouldst lead me on.
I loved to choose and see my path; but now
Lead thou me on!
I loved the garish day, and, spite of fears,
Pride ruled my will. Remember not past years.
3: So long thy pow’r hath blest me, sure it still
Will lead me on
O’er moor and fen, o’er crag and torrent, till
The night is gone.
And with the morn those angel faces smile,
Which I have loved long since, and lost awhile.

98.title: I Need Thee Every Hour
lines: 1: I need thee every hour,
Most gracious Lord.
No tender voice like thine
Can peace afford.
Ch: I need thee, oh, I need thee;
Every hour I need thee!
Oh, bless me now, my Savior;
I come to thee!
2: I need thee every hour;
Stay thou nearby.
Temptations lose their pow’r
When thou art nigh.
Ch: I need thee, oh, I need thee;
Every hour I need thee!
Oh, bless me now, my Savior;
I come to thee!
3: I need thee every hour,
In joy or pain.
Come quickly and abide,
Or life is vain.
Ch: I need thee, oh, I need thee;
Every hour I need thee!
Oh, bless me now, my Savior;
I come to thee!
4: I need thee every hour,
Most holy One.
Oh, make me thine indeed,
Thou blessed Son.
Ch: I need thee, oh, I need thee;
Every hour I need thee!
Oh, bless me now, my Savior;
I come to thee!

99.title: Nearer, Dear Savior, to Thee
lines: 1: Nearer, dear Savior, to thee,
Nearer, still nearer to thee,
Let me be, blessed Lord,
Guided and led by thy word,
Hearing thy voice in my soul,
Making my spirit whole.
2: Nearer, dear Savior, to thee,
Nearer, still nearer to thee,
Help me, O Lord, I pray,
Walk in thy footsteps today,
That I may ever be found
Firm on thy holy ground.

100.title: Nearer, My God, to Thee
lines: 1: Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!
E’en though it be a cross
That raiseth me,
Still all my song shall be,
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!
2: Though like the wanderer,
The sun gone down,
Darkness be over me,
My rest a stone,
Yet in my dreams I’d be
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!
3: There let the way appear,
Steps unto heav’n;
All that thou sendest me,
In mercy giv’n;
Angels to beckon me
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!
4: Then, with my waking thoughts
Bright with thy praise,
Out of my stony griefs
Bethel I’ll raise;
So by my woes to be
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!
5: Or if, on joyful wing
Cleaving the sky,
Sun, moon, and stars forgot,
Upward I fly,
Still all my song shall be,
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!

101.title: Guide Me to Thee
lines: 1: Guide me to thee, my Savior;
Guide me to thee.
I would be thine forever;
I would be free
From all the chains of sin that bind
And hold in thrall my weary mind.
Guide me to thee, my Savior;
Guide me to thee.
2: I know that I am erring;
I know that I am weak.
The path of sin preferring,
Thy help I did not seek.
But now my heart is turning,
My spirit yearns for thee.
With contrite heart returning,
I pray thee, guide thou me.

102.title: Jesus, Lover of My Soul
lines: 1: Jesus, lover of my soul,
Let me to thy bosom fly,
While the nearer waters roll,
While the tempest still is high.
Hide me, O my Savior, hide,
Till the storm of life is past.
Safe into the haven guide;
Oh, receive my soul at last.
2: Other refuge have I none;
Hangs my helpless soul on thee.
Leave, oh, leave me not alone;
Still support and comfort me.
All my trust on thee is stayed;
All my help from thee I bring.
Cover my defenseless head
With the shadow of thy wing.

103.title: Precious Savior, Dear Redeemer
lines: 1: Precious Savior, dear Redeemer,
We are thine, thou Son of God.
Thou hast bought us, dear Redeemer;
With thy precious, precious blood.
Let thy Spirit, let thy Spirit
Ever be our constant guide;
Let thy Spirit, let thy Spirit
In our humble hearts abide.
2: Precious Savior, dear Redeemer,
Thou didst love us, this we know.
In our weakness thou wilt make us
Strong to conquer ev’ry foe.
Let us, Savior, let us, Savior,
Ever be as one with thee,
Let us, Savior, let us, Savior,
Thine to all eternity.

104.title: Jesus, Savior, Pilot Me
lines: 1: Jesus, Savior, pilot me
Over life’s tempestuous sea;
Unknown waves before me roll,
Hiding rock and treach’rous shoal.
Chart and compass come from thee.
Jesus, Savior, pilot me.
2: As a mother stills her child,
Thou canst hush the ocean wild;
Boist’rous waves obey thy will
When thou say’st to them, “Be still!”
Wondrous Sov’reign of the sea,
Jesus, Savior, pilot me.
3: When at last I near the shore,
And the fearful breakers roar
’Twixt me and the peaceful rest,
Then, while leaning on thy breast,
May I hear thee say to me,
“Fear not, I will pilot thee.”

105.title: Master, the Tempest Is Raging
lines: 1: Master, the tempest is raging!
The billows are tossing high!
The sky is o’ershadowed with blackness,
No shelter or help is nigh.
“Carest thou not that we perish?”
How canst thou lie asleep
When each moment so madly is threat’ning
A grave in the angry deep?
Ch: The winds and the waves shall obey thy will,
Peace, be still!
Whether the wrath of the storm-tossed sea,
Or demons or men or whatever it be,
No waters can swallow the ship where lies
The Master of ocean and earth and skies.
They all shall sweetly obey thy will.
Peace, be still! Peace, be still!
They all shall sweetly obey thy will.
Peace, peace, be still!
2: Master, with anguish of spirit
I bow in my grief today.
The depths of my sad heart are troubled.
Oh, waken and save, I pray!
Torrents of sin and of anguish
Sweep o’er my sinking soul,
And I perish! I perish! dear Master.
Oh, hasten and take control!
Ch: The winds and the waves shall obey thy will,
Peace, be still!
Whether the wrath of the storm-tossed sea,
Or demons or men or whatever it be,
No waters can swallow the ship where lies
The Master of ocean and earth and skies.
They all shall sweetly obey thy will.
Peace, be still! Peace, be still!
They all shall sweetly obey thy will.
Peace, peace, be still!
3: Master, the terror is over.
The elements sweetly rest.
Earth’s sun in the calm lake is mirrored,
And heaven’s within my breast.
Linger, O blessed Redeemer!
Leave me alone no more,
And with joy I shall make the blest harbor
And rest on the blissful shore.
Ch: The winds and the waves shall obey thy will,
Peace, be still!
Whether the wrath of the storm-tossed sea,
Or demons or men or whatever it be,
No waters can swallow the ship where lies
The Master of ocean and earth and skies.
They all shall sweetly obey thy will.
Peace, be still! Peace, be still!
They all shall sweetly obey thy will.
Peace, peace, be still!

106.title: God Speed the Right
lines: 1: Now to heav’n our prayer ascending,
God speed the right;
In a noble cause contending,
God speed the right.
Be our zeal in heav’n recorded,
With success on earth rewarded.
God speed the right,
God speed the right.
2: Be that prayer again repeated,
God speed the right;
Ne’er despairing, though defeated,
God speed the right.
Like the good and great in story,
If we fail, we fail with glory.
God speed the right,
God speed the right.
3: Patient, firm, and persevering,
God speed the right;
No event nor danger fearing,
God speed the right.
Pains, nor toils, nor trials heeding,
And in heav’n’s own strength succeeding,
God speed the right,
God speed the right.

107.title: Lord, Accept Our True Devotion
lines: 1: Lord, accept our true devotion,
Offered in thy holy name,
As with cheerful, pure emotion
We thy wondrous love proclaim.
2: All our talents, all our labors,
We will dedicate to thee,
And with loving hearts and favors
We will serve thee faithfully.
3: For the gospel of salvation,
For thy priesthood’s pow’r and might,
For the hope of exaltation,
We will praise thee day and night.

108.title: The Lord Is My Shepherd
lines: 1: The Lord is my shepherd; no want shall I know.
I feed in green pastures; safe-folded I rest.
He leadeth my soul where the still waters flow,
Restores me when wand’ring, redeems when oppressed;
Restores me when wand’ring, redeems when oppressed.
2: Through the valley and shadow of death though I stray,
Since thou art my guardian, no evil I fear.
Thy rod shall defend me, thy staff be my stay;
No harm can befall, with my Comforter near;
No harm can befall, with my Comforter near.
3: In the midst of affliction, my table is spread;
With blessings unmeasured my cup runneth o’er;
With perfume and oil thou anointest my head;
Oh, what shall I ask of thy providence more?
Oh, what shall I ask of thy providence more?
4: Let goodness and mercy, my bountiful God,
Still follow my steps till I meet thee above.
I seek by the path which my forefathers trod
Through the land of their sojourn, thy kingdom of love;
Through the land of their sojourn, thy kingdom of love.

109.title: The Lord My Pasture Will Prepare
lines: 1: The Lord my pasture will prepare
And feed me with a shepherd’s care.
His presence will my wants supply
And guard me with a watchful eye;
My noonday walks he will attend
And all my silent midnight hours defend.
2: When in the sultry glebe I faint,
Or on the thirsty mountain pant,
To fertile vales and dewy meads
My weary, wand’ring steps he leads,
Where peaceful rivers, soft and slow,
Amid the verdant landscape flow.
3: Though in the paths of death I tread,
With gloomy horrors overspread,
