My steadfast heart shall fear no ill,
For thou, O Lord, art with me still.
Thy friendly crook shall give me aid
And guide me through the dreadful shade.

110.title: Cast Thy Burden upon the Lord
lines: 1: Cast thy burden upon the Lord,
And he will thee restore.
He thy righteous cause will plead
And bless thee evermore.

111.title: Rock of Ages
lines: 1: Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in thee;
Let the water and the blood,
From thy wounded side which flowed,
Be of sin the double cure;
Save from wrath and make me pure.
2: Not the labors of my hands
Can fulfill thy law’s demands;
Could my zeal no respite know,
Could my tears forever flow,
All for sin could not atone;
Thou must save, and thou alone.
3: Nothing in my hand I bring;
Simply to thy cross I cling.
Naked, come to thee for dress;
Helpless, look to thee for grace;
Foul, I to the fountain fly;
Wash me, Savior, or I die.
4: While I draw this fleeting breath,
When my eyes shall close in death,
When I soar to worlds unknown,
See thee on thy judgment throne,
Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in thee.

112.title: Savior, Redeemer of My Soul
lines: 1: Savior, Redeemer of my soul,
Whose mighty hand hath made me whole,
Whose wondrous pow’r hath raised me up,
Whose goodness fills my cup,
What tongue my gratitude can tell,
O gracious God of Israel.
2: Never can I repay thee, Lord,
But I can love thee. Thy pure word,
Hath it not been my one delight,
My joy by day, my dream by night?
Then let my lips proclaim it still,
And all my life reflect thy will.
3: O’errule mine acts to serve thine ends.
Change frowning foes to smiling friends.
Chasten my soul till I shall be
In perfect harmony with thee.
Make me more worthy of thy love,
And fit me for the life above.

113.title: Our Savior's Love
lines: 1: Our Savior’s love
Shines like a beacon in the night,
And guides us on our pilgrim way.
It is a star that shines so bright
It turns our darkness into day.
2: Our Savior’s love
Is boundless, deep, and pure and free.
It is a fount of endless grace.
It is a stream that flows for me
And cleanses me and gives me place.

114.title: Come unto Him
lines: 1: Come unto him, all ye that labor,
And he will give you rest.
Come unto him, all ye that wander;
Come, and ye shall be blest.
Ch: Come unto him; come unto him.
Come, and he will give you rest.
Come unto him; come unto him.
Come, and he will give you rest.
2: Come unto him, all ye that sorrow,
And he will soothe your grief.
Come unto him, and on the morrow
He’ll send you sweet relief.
Ch: Come unto him; come unto him.
Come, and he will give you rest.
Come unto him; come unto him.
Come, and he will give you rest.

115.title: Come, Ye Disconsolate
lines: 1: Come, ye disconsolate, where’er ye languish;
Come to the mercy seat, fervently kneel.
Here bring your wounded hearts; here tell your anguish.
Earth has no sorrow that heav’n cannot heal.
2: Joy of the desolate, light of the straying,
Hope of the penitent, fadeless and pure,
Here speaks the Comforter, tenderly saying,
“Earth has no sorrow that heav’n cannot cure.”
3: Here see the Bread of Life; see waters flowing
Forth from the throne of God, pure from above.
Come to the feast of love; come, ever knowing
Earth has no sorrow but heav’n can remove.

116.title: Come, Follow Me
lines: 1: “Come, follow me,” the Savior said.
Then let us in his footsteps tread,
For thus alone can we be one
With God’s own loved, begotten Son.
2: “Come, follow me,” a simple phrase,
Yet truth’s sublime, implicit rays
Are in these simple words combined
To urge, inspire the human mind.
3: Is it enough alone to know
That we must follow him below,
While trav’ling in this vale of tears?
No, this extends to holier spheres.
4: Not only shall we emulate
His course while in this earthly state,
But when we’re freed from present cares,
If we would be joint-heirs with him,
We must be pure and free from sin.

117.title: Come unto Jesus
lines: 1: Come unto Jesus, ye heavy laden,
Careworn and fainting, by sin oppressed.
He’ll safely guide you unto that haven
Where all who trust him may rest.
2: Come unto Jesus; he’ll ever heed you,
Though in the darkness you’ve gone astray.
His love will find you and gently lead you
From darkest night to his day.
3: Come unto Jesus; he’ll surely hear you,
If you in meekness plead for his love.
Oh, know you not that he’s ever near you,
And will your sins all remove?
4: Come unto Jesus from ev’ry nation,
From ev’ry land and isle of the sea.
Unto the high and the lowly station,
Ever he calls, “Come to me.”

118.title: Ye Simple Souls Who Stray
lines: 1: Ye simple souls who stray
Far from the path of peace,
That lonely, unfrequented way
To life and happiness,
Why will ye folly love
And throng the downward road,
And hate the wisdom from above,
And mock the sons of God?
2: Madness and misery
Ye count our life beneath,
And nothing great or good can see
Or glorious in our death.
As only born to grieve,
Beneath your feet we lie,
And utterly condemned we live,
And unlamented die.
3: So wretched and obscure,
The men whom ye despise,
So foolish, impotent, and poor,
Above your scorn we rise.
We, through the Holy Ghost,
Can witness better things;
For he whose blood is all our boast
Hath made us priests and kings.

119.title: Come, We That Love the Lord
lines: 1: Come, we that love the Lord,
And let our joys be known;
Join in a song with sweet accord,
And thus surround the throne.
2: Let those refuse to sing
Who never knew our God;
But children of the heav’nly King
May speak their joys abroad.
3: The men of grace have found
Glory begun below.
Celestial fruits on earthly ground
From faith and hope may grow.
4: The hill of Zion yields
A thousand sacred sweets
Before we reach the heav’nly fields
Or walk the golden streets.
5: Then let our songs abound,
And ev’ry tear be dry;
We’re marching through Immanuel’s ground
To fairer worlds on high.

120.title: Lean on My Ample Arm
lines: 1: Lean on my ample arm,
O thou depressed!
And I will bid the storm
Cease in thy breast.
What is the world to thee,
With all its vaunted pleasure,
When I thy rest can be,
Thy lasting treasure?
2: Lean on my ample arm,
O thou distress’d!
I will thy foes disarm,
And give thee rest.
When thou dost feel the smart
Of persecution’s rod,
I’ll press thee to my heart,
Thy Savior, God.

121.title: I'm a Pilgrim, I'm a Stranger
121.safe_title: Im a Pilgrim, Im a Stranger
lines: 1: I’m a pilgrim, I’m a stranger;
I can tarry, I can tarry but a night!
Do not detain me, for I am going
To where the fountains are ever flowing.
Ch: I’m a pilgrim, I’m a stranger;
I can tarry, I can tarry but a night!
2: There the sunbeams are ever shining;
I am longing, I am longing for the sight.
Within a country unknown and dreary,
I have been wand’ring forlorn and weary.
Ch: I’m a pilgrim, I’m a stranger;
I can tarry, I can tarry but a night!
3: Of that country to which I’m going,
My Redeemer, my Redeemer is the light!
There is no sorrow, nor any sighing,
Nor any tears there, nor any dying.
Ch: I’m a pilgrim, I’m a stranger;
I can tarry, I can tarry but a night!

122.title: Though Deepening Trials
lines: 1: Though deepening trials throng your way,
Press on, press on, ye Saints of God!
Ere long the resurrection day
Will spread its life and truth abroad.
2: Though outward ills await us here,
The hand of God is over all.
And he will ever be our cheer,
And raise us when we faint and fall.
3: Though to the dust we must return,
And in the silent grave must lie,
Our spirits will with transport burn,
And soar to realms beyond the sky.
4: Then let us triumph in the Lord,
And in our God and Savior trust.
We will be true to his commands,
And live and die among the just.

123.title: Oh, May My Soul Commune with Thee
lines: 1: Oh, may my soul commune with thee,
And find thy holy peace,
And may my mind from care be free,
That worldly thoughts may cease.
2: Oh, may my soul be filled with light,
That I may see thy will,
And with thy Spirit’s holy might,
Thy purposes fulfill.

124.title: Be Still, My Soul
lines: 1: Be still, my soul: The Lord is on thy side;
With patience bear thy cross of grief or pain.
Leave to thy God to order and provide;
In ev’ry change he faithful will remain.
Be still, my soul: Thy best, thy heav’nly Friend
Through thorny ways leads to a joyful end.
2: Be still, my soul: Thy God doth undertake
To guide the future as he has the past.
Thy hope, thy confidence, let nothing shake;
All now mysterious shall be bright at last.
Be still, my soul: The waves and winds still know
His voice who ruled them while he dwelt below.
3: Be still, my soul: The hour is hast’ning on
When we shall be forever with the Lord,
When disappointment, grief, and fear are gone,
Sorrow forgot, love’s purest joys restored.
Be still, my soul: When change and tears are past,
All safe and blessed we shall meet at last.

125.title: How Gentle God's Commands
lines: 1: How gentle God’s commands!
How kind his precepts are!
Come, cast your burdens on the Lord
And trust his constant care.
2: While Providence supports,
Let saints securely dwell;
That hand which bears all nature up
Shall guide his children well.
3: Why should this anxious load
Press down your weary mind?
Haste to your Heav’nly Father’s throne
And sweet refreshment find.
4: His goodness stands approved,
Unchanged from day to day;
I’ll drop my burden at his feet
And bear a song away.

126.title: How Long, O Lord Most Holy and True
lines: 1: How long, O Lord most holy and true,
Wilt thou suffer thy people to be
Oppressed by the wicked, who mock thee and say,
“Where is now your God, and where is his decree?”
2: How long, O Lord, wilt thou look on,
While the nations exult in their might,
And boast in their riches and splendor and fame,
And trample the weak and the poor in their sight?
3: How long shall the wicked bear rule?
How long shall the righteous complain?
How long shall the earth be defiled with their sin?
How long ere the day of thy coming shall reign?

127.title: Does the Journey Seem Long?
lines: 1: Does the journey seem long,
The path rugged and steep?
Are there briars and thorns on the way?
Does your heart sink in fear,
And your eyes often weep,
As you toil on your journey each day?
Ch: Take courage, my friend,
Let your heart not despair;
There is One who will carry you through.
He will bring you to Zion,
To dwell with him there,
If you’ll only be faithful and true.
2: Do the trifles of life
Seem so heavy to bear,
And you think that you cannot go on?
Do you feel that your cross
Is too heavy to wear,
And you long for your journey to end?
Ch: Take courage, my friend,
Let your heart not despair;
There is One who will carry you through.
He will bring you to Zion,
To dwell with him there,
If you’ll only be faithful and true.

128.title: When Faith Endures
lines: 1: When faith endures, we feel the pow’r
Of him who is our shield and tow’r.
We feel the strength that comes from God
To walk the path our fathers trod.
2: When faith endures, we learn to trust
In God, our Father, who is just.
We learn to love his holy Son
And say, “Thy will, not mine, be done.”

129.title: Where Can I Turn for Peace?
129.safe_title: Where Can I Turn for Peace
lines: 1: Where can I turn for peace?
Where is my solace
When other sources cease to make me whole?
When with a wounded heart, anger, or malice,
I draw myself apart, searching my soul?
2: Where, when my aching grows,
Where, when I languish,
Who, who can understand? He, only One.
He answers privately, reaches my reaching
In my Gethsemane, Savior and Friend.
3: Gentle the peace he finds for my beseeching.
Constant he is and kind, love without end.

130.title: Be Thou Humble
lines: 1: Be thou humble in thy weakness,
And the Lord thy God shall lead thee,
Shall lead thee by the hand and give thee answer to thy prayers.
Be thou humble in thy searching,
And the Lord thy God shall teach thee
To see the greater things, the things of God, the things of eternal worth.
Ch: Be thou humble, be thou humble,
Be thou humble and the Lord thy God shall lead thee.
2: Be thou humble in thy calling,
And the Lord thy God shall bless thee,
And give to thee a tongue of angels, and with it thou shalt praise his name.
Be thou humble in thy striving,
And the Lord thy God shall crown thee
With grace and glory, and with honor, and with eternal life.
Ch: Be thou humble, be thou humble,
Be thou humble and the Lord thy God shall lead thee.

131.title: More Holiness Give Me
lines: 1: More holiness give me,
More strivings within,
More patience in suff’ring,
More sorrow for sin,
More faith in my Savior,
More sense of his care,
More joy in his service,
More purpose in prayer.
2: More gratitude give me,
More trust in the Lord,
More pride in his glory,
More hope in his word,
More tears for his sorrows,
More pain at his grief,
More meekness in trial,
More praise for relief.
3: More purity give me,
More strength to o’ercome,
More freedom from earth-stains,
More longings for home.
More fit for the kingdom,
More used would I be,
More blessed and holy—
More, Savior, like thee.

132.title: God Is in His Holy Temple
lines: 1: God is in his holy temple;
Earthly thoughts, be silent now,
While with reverence we assemble,
And before his presence bow.
He is with us, now and ever,
When we call upon his name,
Aiding every good endeavor,
Guiding every upward aim.
2: God is in his holy temple;
In the pure and holy mind;
In the thoughts that now assemble,
And in all of good we find.
He is with us, here among us;
Let our thoughts be pure and clean,
That we may not wrongly use them,
And his Spirit grieve within.

133.title: Father in Heaven
lines: 1: Father in Heaven, in thy love abounding,
Hear these thy children, thru the world resounding,
Singing thy praises, songs of adoration,
Taught by thy Spirit, Spirit of creation.
2: Grant us, O Father, grace and guidance ever,
That from thy precepts we may wander never.
May we be faithful, strong in thine own Spirit,
And with the righteous thy full joy inherit.

134.title: I Believe in Christ
lines: 1: I believe in Christ; he is my King!
With all my heart to him I’ll sing;
I’ll raise my voice in praise and joy,
In grand amens my tongue employ.
I believe in Christ; he is God’s Son.
On earth to dwell his soul did come.
He healed the sick; the dead he raised.
Good works were his; his name be praised.
2: I believe in Christ; O blessed name!
As Mary’s Son he came to reign
’Mid mortal men, his earthly kin,
To save them from the woes of sin.
I believe in Christ, who marked the path,
Who did gain all his Father hath,
Who said to men: “Come, follow me,
That ye, my friends, with God may be.”
3: I believe in Christ—my Lord, my God!
My feet he plants on gospel sod.
I’ll worship him with all my might;
He is the source of truth and light.
I believe in Christ; he ransoms me.
From Satan’s grasp he sets me free,
And I shall live with joy and love
In his eternal courts above.
4: I believe in Christ; he stands supreme!
From him I’ll gain my fondest dream;
And while I strive through grief and pain,
His voice directs my life’s refrain.
I believe in Christ; I’ll him obey.
I’ll seek his guidance day by day.
I’ll speak his word; I’ll do his will.
I’ll follow him through good or ill.

135.title: My Redeemer Lives
lines: 1: I know that my Redeemer lives.
What comfort this sweet sentence gives!
He lives, he lives, who once was dead.
He lives, my ever-living Head.
He lives to bless me with his love.
He lives to plead for me above.
He lives my hungry soul to feed.
He lives to bless in time of need.
2: He lives to grant me rich supply.
He lives to guide me with his eye.
He lives to comfort me when faint.
He lives to hear my soul’s complaint.
He lives to silence all my fears.
He lives to wipe away my tears.
He lives to calm my troubled heart.
He lives all blessings to impart.
3: He lives, my kind, wise heav’nly Friend.
He lives and loves me to the end.
He lives, and while he lives, I’ll sing.
He lives, my Prophet, Priest, and King.
He lives and grants me daily breath.
He lives, and I shall conquer death.
He lives my mansion to prepare.
He lives to bring me safely there.
4: He lives! All glory to his name!
He lives, my Jesus, still the same.
Oh, sweet the joy this sentence gives:
“I know that my Redeemer lives!”

136.title: I Know That My Redeemer Lives
lines: 1: I know that my Redeemer lives;
Therefore I too shall live.
He lives, my Prophet, Priest, and King;
What joy this knowledge gives!
He lives to plead for me above;
He lives to bless me with his love;
He lives to silence all my fears;
He lives to wipe away my tears.
2: He lives to calm my troubled heart;
He lives all blessings to impart.
He lives my hungry soul to feed;
He lives to help in time of need.
He lives, and while he lives, I’ll sing,
“I know that my Redeemer lives.”

137.title: Testimony
lines: 1: The Spirit of God has wrought a change in my heart.
The darkness of Satan is gone.
The Spirit of God has planted a seed in my heart.
And now I can sing a new song.
Ch: I have a testimony of Jesus’ love for me.
I know that he died on the cross of Calvary.
I know that he lives, for the Spirit speaks to me.
I know that he lives, my Savior and my King.
2: No longer I wander in darkness and sin;
The light of the gospel shines bright.
I know that my Savior has cleansed me within,
And now I can walk in his light.
Ch: I have a testimony of Jesus’ love for me.
I know that he died on the cross of Calvary.
I know that he lives, for the Spirit speaks to me.
I know that he lives, my Savior and my King.

138.title: Bless Our Fast, We Pray
lines: 1: Bless our fast, we pray;
Bless our fast, we pray.
Lord, on this day, hear us now.
Bless our fast, we pray;
Bless our fast, we pray.
Humbly we bow.
2: Give us strength to bear,
Strength to do our share.
Lord, may our prayer answered be.
Give us strength to bear,
Strength to do our share,
Sharing with thee.

139.title: In Fasting We Approach Thee
lines: 1: In fasting we approach thee,
Our Father and our God,
To ask for thy rich blessings,
According to thy word.
2: We thank thee for thy goodness,
For all thy gifts so free,
And pray that we may ever
Be found in unity.

140.title: Did You Think to Pray?
lines: 1: Ere you left your room this morning,
Did you think to pray?
In the name of Christ, our Savior,
Did you sue for loving favor
As a shield today?
Ch: Oh, how praying rests the weary!
Prayer will change the night to day.
So, when life gets dark and dreary,
Don’t forget to pray.
2: When your heart was filled with anger,
Did you think to pray?
Did you plead for grace, my brother,
That you might forgive another
Who had crossed your way?
Ch: Oh, how praying rests the weary!
Prayer will change the night to day.
So, when life gets dark and dreary,
Don’t forget to pray.
3: When sore trials came upon you,
Did you think to pray?
When your soul was full of sorrow,
Balm of Gilead did you borrow
At the gates of day?
Ch: Oh, how praying rests the weary!
Prayer will change the night to day.
So, when life gets dark and dreary,
Don’t forget to pray.

141.title: Jesus, the Very Thought of Thee
lines: 1: Jesus, the very thought of thee
With sweetness fills my breast;
But sweeter far thy face to see
And in thy presence rest.
2: Nor voice can sing, nor heart can frame,
Nor can the memory find
A sweeter sound than thy blest name,
O Savior of mankind!
3: O hope of every contrite heart,
O joy of all the meek,
To those who fall, how kind thou art!
How good to those who seek!
4: But what to those who find? Ah, this
Nor tongue nor pen can show;
The love of Jesus, what it is,
None but his loved ones know.

142.title: Sweet Hour of Prayer
lines: 1: Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
That calls me from a world of care
And bids me at my Father’s throne
Make all my wants and wishes known.
In seasons of distress and grief,
My soul has often found relief,
And oft escaped the tempter’s snare
By thy return, sweet hour of prayer!
2: Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
Thy wings shall my petition bear
To him whose truth and faithfulness
Engage the waiting soul to bless.
And since he bids me seek his face,
Believe his word, and trust his grace,
I’ll cast on him my every care
And wait for thee, sweet hour of prayer!
3: Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
May I thy consolation share,
Till, from Mount Pisgah’s lofty height,
I view my home and take my flight.
This robe of flesh I’ll drop and rise
To seize the everlasting prize,
And shout, while passing through the air,
“Farewell, farewell, sweet hour of prayer!”

143.title: Let the Holy Spirit Guide
lines: 1: Let the Holy Spirit guide;
Let him teach us what is true.
He will testify of Christ,
Light our minds with heaven’s view.
2: Let the Holy Spirit guard;
Let his whisper govern choice.
He will lead us in the paths
Of the straight and narrow course.
3: Let the Holy Spirit dwell
In our hearts and homes and lives.
He will cheer us on our way,
Comfort us when sorrow thrives.

144.title: Secret Prayer
lines: 1: There is an hour of peace and rest,
Unmarred by earthly care;
’Tis when I seek my Father’s breast
And find sweet solace there.
’Tis when I plead in secret prayer,
My spirit to prepare,
To meet the trials I must bear.
Oh, what a balm is prayer!
2: There is a joy I can’t express,
A trust I hold so dear;
’Tis when I feel his tenderness
And know that he is near.
When I am bowed in secret prayer,
My heart to him I bare.
I feel a heav’nly solace there.
Oh, what a balm is prayer!
3: There is a strength I can’t explain,
A pow’r I can’t deny;
’Tis when I call upon his name,
And he is ever nigh.
When I am filled with deep despair,
My burdens to him bear,
My soul is lightened of its care.
Oh, what a balm is prayer!

145.title: Prayer Is the Soul's Sincere Desire
145.safe_title: Prayer Is the Souls Sincere Desire
lines: 1: Prayer is the soul’s sincere desire,
Uttered or unexpressed,
The motion of a hidden fire
That trembles in the breast.
2: Prayer is the burden of a sigh,
The falling of a tear,
The upward glancing of an eye,
When none but God is near.
3: Prayer is the simplest form of speech
That infant lips can try;
Prayer, the sublimest strains that reach
The Majesty on high.
4: Prayer is the Christian’s vital breath,
The Christian’s native air,
His watchword at the gates of death;
He enters heav’n with prayer.
5: Prayer is the contrite sinner’s voice,
Returning from his ways,
While angels in their songs rejoice
And cry, “Behold, he prays!”
6: O thou by whom we come to God,
The Life, the Truth, the Way!
The path of prayer thyself has trod;
Lord, teach us how to pray.

146.title: Gently Raise the Sacred Strain
lines: 1: Gently raise the sacred strain,
For the Sabbath’s come again,
That man may rest,
That man may rest,
And return his thanks to God,
For his blessings to the blest.
2: Holy day, devoid of strife,
Let us seek eternal life,
That we may rest,
That we may rest,
From the cares of this vain world,
And find peace in Jesus’ breast.
3: Sweetly sound the holy call;
Let the swelling numbers fall,
That all may rest,
That all may rest,
And partake the sacrament,
And be by the Savior blest.

147.title: Sweet Is the Work
lines: 1: Sweet is the work, my God, my King,
To praise thy name, give thanks and sing,
To show thy love by morning light,
And talk of all thy truths at night.
2: Sweet is the day of sacred rest.
No mortal cares shall seize my breast.
Oh, may my heart in tune be found,
Like David’s harp of solemn sound!
3: My heart shall triumph in my Lord
And bless his works and bless his word.
Thy works of grace, how bright they shine!
How deep thy counsels, how divine!
4: And I shall share a glorious part
When grace hath well refined my heart,
And fresh supplies of joy are shed,
Like holy oil to cheer my head.
5: Then shall I see and hear and know
All I desired or wished below,
And every pow’r find sweet employ
In that eternal world of joy.

148.title: Sabbath Day
lines: 1: Welcome, day of sweet repose;
Welcome, day of joy and love;
Welcome, day that saw him rise
From the tomb to worlds above.
2: Sabbath day, we hail thy light,
Thee we love and thee we praise.
May we ever keep thee right,
Ever walk in wisdom’s ways.

149.title: As the Dew from Heaven Distilling
lines: 1: As the dew from heav’n distilling
Gently on the grass descends
And revives the new-mown meadows,
So thy grace, O Lord, attend.
2: Let thy word be as the rain-drops
That refresh the thirsty ground;
Let it fall on thirsty spirits,
That they may with fruit abound.

150.title: O Thou Kind and Gracious Father
lines: 1: O thou kind and gracious Father,
In the fulness of thy grace,
Make us pure and draw us to thee;
Let us see thy glorious face.
2: Let thy spirit’s sweet anointing
Rest upon us, Lord, we pray.
Let us walk in paths of wisdom,
And with thee find favor, pray.

151.title: We Meet, Dear Lord
lines: 1: We meet, dear Lord, in this thy house,
To sing thy praise and hear thy word,
To offer thee our sacred vows,
And ask thy blessings, dearest Lord.
2: We thank thee for thy loving care,
For all thy mercies rich and free,
And pray that we may ever share
Thy love and blessings constantly.

152.title: God Be with You Till We Meet Again
lines: 1: God be with you till we meet again;
By his counsels guide, uphold you,
With his sheep securely fold you.
God be with you till we meet again.
Ch: Till we meet, till we meet,
Till we meet at Jesus’ feet.
Till we meet, till we meet,
God be with you till we meet again.
2: God be with you till we meet again;
’Neath his wings securely hide you,
Daily manna still provide you.
God be with you till we meet again.
Ch: Till we meet, till we meet,
Till we meet at Jesus’ feet.
Till we meet, till we meet,
God be with you till we meet again.
3: God be with you till we meet again;
When life’s perils thick confound you,
Put his arms unfailing round you.
God be with you till we meet again.
Ch: Till we meet, till we meet,
Till we meet at Jesus’ feet.
Till we meet, till we meet,
God be with you till we meet again.

153.title: Lord, We Ask Thee Ere We Part
lines: 1: Lord, we ask thee ere we part,
Bless us with a thankful heart.
Bless us with thy Spirit’s might,
Fill our souls with heav’nly light.
2: Bless us, Lord, that we may be
Strong in faith and trust in thee.
Bless us, Lord, that we may know
How to conquer ev’ry foe.

154.title: Father, This Hour Has Been One of Joy
lines: 1: Father, this hour has been one of joy,
As we have feasted on thy word,
And now we go to our employ,
To serve and worship thee, O Lord.
Ch: Thy Spirit, Lord, with us abide,
That we may ever walk with thee,
In paths of truth and virtue guide,
And thine shall all the glory be.
2: May we thy counsels all fulfill,
And in thine own appointed way,
Perform thy righteous, holy will,
And serve thee faithfully each day.
Ch: Thy Spirit, Lord, with us abide,
That we may ever walk with thee,
In paths of truth and virtue guide,
And thine shall all the glory be.

155.title: We Have Partaken of Thy Love
lines: 1: We have partaken of thy love,
O Father, in thy Son.
We have been blessed from above;
Thy will on earth be done.
2: We thank thee for thy goodness, Lord;
We thank thee for thy grace.
We thank thee for thy holy word,
And for this sacred place.

156.title: Sing We Now at Parting
lines: 1: Sing we now at parting
One more strain of praise;
To our gracious Father
Humble voices raise.
For his loving kindness,
For his tender care,
Let our songs of gladness
Fill this Sabbath air.
2: Praise him for the Sabbath,
For its peaceful hours,
For the blessed gospel,
With its saving pow’rs,
For the holy Priesthood,
Restless to redeem,
For the gentle flowing
Of the Spirit’s stream.

157.title: Thy Spirit, Lord, Has Stirred Our Souls
lines: 1: Thy Spirit, Lord, has stirred our souls
And calmed our troubled minds.
Now coolness reigns where passion burned;
Now peaceful rest one finds.
2: The discontent, the doubt, the fear,
That cloud our mortal day,
We feel will shortly disappear
As truth lights up our way.

158.title: Before Thee, Lord, I Bow My Head
lines: 1: Before thee, Lord, I bow my head
And thank thee for thy love to me.
I thank thee for the words he said,
“Come, follow me; come, follow me.”
2: I’ll follow thee, my Lord and King.
I will be true and faithful to thee.
I’ll do the things thou’st bidden me,
And I will ever follow thee.

159.title: Now the Day Is Over
lines: 1: Now the day is over,
Night is drawing nigh;
Shadows of the evening
Steal across the sky.
2: Jesus, give the weary
Calm and sweet repose;
With thy tend’rest blessing
May our eyelids close.
3: Comfort ev’ry suff’rer
Watching late in pain;
Those who plan some evil
From their sin restrain.
4: When the morning wakens,
Then may I arise
Pure and fresh and sinless
In thy holy eyes.

160.title: Softly Now the Light of Day
lines: 1: Softly now the light of day
Fades upon my sight away.
Free from care, from labor free,
Lord, I would commune with thee.
2: Thou whose all-pervading eye
Naught escapes, without, within,
Pardon each infirmity,
Open fault and secret sin.
3: Soon for me the light of day
Shall forever pass away;
Then, from sin and sorrow free,
Take me, Lord, to dwell with thee.

161.title: The Lord Be with Us
lines: 1: The Lord be with us as we bend
His blessing to receive;
His grace upon us all descend,
Ere we his temple leave.
2: The Lord be with us as we walk
Along our homeward road;
In silent thought or friendly talk,
Our hearts be still with God.
3: The Lord be with us till the night
Shall close the day of rest;
Be he of every heart the Light,
Of every home the Guest.

162.title: Lord, We Come before Thee Now
lines: 1: Lord, we come before thee now;
At thy feet we humbly bow.
Oh, do not our suit disdain!
Shall we seek thee, Lord, in vain?
Shall we seek thee, Lord, in vain?
2: In our own behalf we seek
Life and strength for all the week.
Grant us, Lord, a rich supply;
All our thirsty souls satisfy.
All our thirsty souls satisfy.
3: Lord, on thee our souls depend;
In compassion now descend.
Fill our hearts with thy rich grace;
Tune our lips to sing thy praise.
Tune our lips to sing thy praise.

163.title: Lord, Dismiss Us with Thy Blessing
lines: 1: Lord, dismiss us with thy blessing;
Fill our hearts with joy and peace.
Let us each, thy love possessing,
Triumph in redeeming grace.
Oh, refresh us, Oh, refresh us,
Trav’ling through this wilderness.
2: Thanks we give and adoration
For thy gospel’s joyful sound.
May the fruits of thy salvation
In our hearts and lives abound.
Ever faithful, ever faithful
To the truth may we be found.

164.title: Great God, to Thee My Evening Song
lines: 1: Great God, to thee my evening song
With humble gratitude I raise.
Oh, let thy mercy tune my tongue
And fill my heart with lively praise.
2: My days unclouded as they pass,
And every gentle, rolling hour,
Are monuments of wondrous grace,
And witness to thy love and pow’r.
3: And yet this thoughtless, wretched heart,
Too apt to wander from thy love,
O’erlook thy bounties and depart
From thee, my hope, my life, my love.
4: Seal my forgiveness in the blood
Of Jesus; his dear name alone
I plead for pardon, gracious God,
And kind acceptance at thy throne.

165.title: Abide with Me; 'Tis Eventide
lines: 1: Abide with me; ’tis eventide.
The day is past and gone;
The shadows of the evening fall;
The night is coming on.
Within my heart a welcome guest,
Within my home abide.
Ch: O Savior, stay this night with me;
Behold, ’tis eventide.
O Savior, stay this night with me;
Behold, ’tis eventide.
2: Abide with me; ’tis eventide.
Thy walk today with me
Has made my heart within me burn,
As I communed with thee.
Thy earnest words have filled my soul
And kept me near thy side.
Ch: O Savior, stay this night with me;
Behold, ’tis eventide.
O Savior, stay this night with me;
Behold, ’tis eventide.
3: Abide with me; ’tis eventide,
And lone will be the night
If I cannot commune with thee
Nor find in thee my light.
The darkness of the world, I fear,
Would in my home abide.
Ch: O Savior, stay this night with me;
Behold, ’tis eventide.
O Savior, stay this night with me;
Behold, ’tis eventide.

166.title: Abide with Me!
lines: 1: Abide with me! fast falls the eventide;
The darkness deepens. Lord, with me abide!
When other helpers fail and comforts flee,
Help of the helpless, oh, abide with me!
2: Swift to its close ebbs out life’s little day;
Earth’s joys grow dim; its glories pass away.
Change and decay in all around I see;
O thou who changest not, abide with me!
3: I need thy presence every passing hour.
What but thy grace can foil the tempter’s pow’r?
Who, like thyself, my guide and stay can be?
Through cloud and sunshine, Lord, abide with me!
4: I fear no foe, with thee at hand to bless;
Ills have no weight, and tears no bitterness.
Where is death’s sting? Where, grave, thy victory?
I triumph still, if thou abide with me.
5: Hold thou thy cross before my closing eyes;
Shine through the gloom and point me to the skies.
Heav’n’s morning breaks, and earth’s vain shadows flee;
In life, in death, O Lord, abide with me!

167.title: Come, Let Us Sing an Evening Hymn
lines: 1: Come, let us sing an evening hymn
To God, the Father of all light.
Let cheerful songs of praise from us
Dispel the darkness of the night.
2: Let God’s own Spirit from above
Now fill our hearts with holy peace,
And let our faith and hope and love
Before him constantly increase.

168.title: As the Shadows Fall
lines: 1: As the shadows fall, at the close of day,
And the sun sinks down in the west,
We will kneel and pray, at the close of day,
And ask God for peace and for rest.
2: We will thank him then for his tender care,
For his blessings all through the day,
And we’ll ask him, too, that his love he’ll share,
As we humbly kneel and pray.

169.title: As Now We Take the Sacrament
lines: 1: As now we take the sacrament,
Our thoughts are turned to thee,
Thou Son of God, who flesh was lent
To suffer on the tree.
2: Oh, may we ever mindful be
Of thy great love for us,
That we may ever live for thee,
And thy commandments keep.

170.title: God, Our Father, Hear Us Pray
lines: 1: God, our Father, hear us pray;
Send thy grace this holy day.
As we take of bread and wine,
Fill our souls with love divine.
2: Let thy Spirit from above
Fill our hearts with peace and love.
May we ever mindful be
Of our Savior’s love for me.

171.title: With Humble Heart
lines: 1: With humble heart, we come to thee,
Our Father and our God,
To ask thy blessings, rich and free,
According to thy word.
2: We thank thee for thy goodness, Lord;
We thank thee for thy grace;
We thank thee for thy holy word,
And for this sacred place.

172.title: In Humility, Our Savior
lines: 1: In humility, our Savior,
Grant thy Spirit here, we pray,
As we bless the bread and water
In thy name this holy day.
Let our hearts be pure before thee;
Let our minds be ever true
That we may be worthy part’ners
In the work we have to do.
2: Let us all remember Jesus
And the cov’nant he has made,
And the mighty atonement
Thru which ev’ry debt is paid.
Let us all remember Jesus,
Who has conquered death and sin,
That we may be clean and spotless
And may enter in.

173.title: While of These Emblems We Partake
lines: 1: While of these emblems we partake,
In Jesus’ name and for his sake,
Let us remember and be sure
Our hearts and hands are clean and pure.
2: For us the blood of Christ was shed;
For us on Calvary’s cross he bled.
And thus dispelled the awful gloom
That else were this creation’s doom.
3: The law was broken, and the word
Of God the Father had been heard,
That life should be the penalty,
And man must die eternally.
4: But mercy, rising in her sphere,
Amends the stern demands to hear,
And God’s own Son himself descends,
And justice’ claim in full attends.
5: He without sin in death has lain
That we might live with him again.
Then, O my soul, be wise and choose
The Prince of Peace, nor him refuse.

174.title: While of These Emblems We Partake
lines: 1: While of these emblems we partake,
In Jesus’ name and for his sake,
Let us remember and be sure
Our hearts and hands are clean and pure.
2: For us the blood of Christ was shed;
For us on Calvary’s cross he bled.
And thus dispelled the awful gloom
That else were this creation’s doom.
3: The law was broken, and the word
Of God the Father had been heard,
That life should be the penalty,
And man must die eternally.
4: But mercy, rising in her sphere,
Amends the stern demands to hear,
And God’s own Son himself descends,
And justice’ claim in full attends.
5: He without sin in death has lain
That we might live with him again.
Then, O my soul, be wise and choose
The Prince of Peace, nor him refuse.

175.title: O God, the Eternal Father
lines: 1: O God, the Eternal Father,
Who dwells on high above,
Regard thy sons and daughters
With thy paternal love.
2: We now are met together
In thy most holy name,
To ask of thee a blessing,
Which we would humbly claim.

176.title: 'Tis Sweet to Sing the Matchless Love
176.safe_title: Tis Sweet to Sing the Matchless Love
lines: 1: ’Tis sweet to sing the matchless love
Of Him who left his throne above,
And came to earth for man to bleed
And save him from his sins indeed.
2: ’Twas love that brought the Savior down,
To leave for us his kingly crown.
’Twas love that caused his blood to flow;
’Twas love that paid the debt we owe.
3: ’Twas love that bore him to the tomb;
’Twas love that broke its dreadful gloom.
’Twas love that made him rise again,
A victor over death and pain.

177.title: 'Tis Sweet to Sing the Matchless Love
177.safe_title: Tis Sweet to Sing the Matchless Love
lines: 1: ’Tis sweet to sing the matchless love
Of Him who left his throne above,
And came to earth for man to bleed
And save him from his sins indeed.
2: ’Twas love that brought the Savior down,
To leave for us his kingly crown.
’Twas love that caused his blood to flow;
’Twas love that paid the debt we owe.
3: ’Twas love that bore him to the tomb;
’Twas love that broke its dreadful gloom.
’Twas love that made him rise again,
A victor over death and pain.

178.title: O Lord of Hosts
lines: 1: O Lord of Hosts, we now invoke
Thy Spirit here to be,
And as we take the bread and wine,
To bring our minds to thee,
To look to thee, our Holy One,
And claim thy promise sweet,
That with the pure in heart and mind
Thy Spirit loves to meet.

179.title: Again, Our Dear Redeeming Lord
lines: 1: Again, our dear redeeming Lord,
We meet around thy sacred board,
And take the emblems of thy death,
And speak thy name with humble breath.
2: In memory of thy broken heart,
We take the bread and bless the part;
And as we drink the sacred wine,
We think of thy great love divine.

180.title: Father in Heaven, We Do Believe
lines: 1: Father in Heaven, we do believe
The words that thy dear Son has giv’n.
We take the bread, and humbly pray,
Bless these our souls with bread from heav’n.
2: Father in Heaven, we do believe
The words that thy dear Son has taught.
We drink the cup, and humbly pray,
Bless these our souls as he has bought.

181.title: Jesus of Nazareth, Savior and King
lines: 1: Jesus of Nazareth, Savior and King,
Triumphant over death, life thou didst bring,
Leaving thy throne above, thy throne above,
To suffer, bleed, and die, all for our love.
All for our love.
2: Though in a manger laid, a lowly birth,
Thou art the God of heav’n, the Lord of earth.
Thou art the great I Am, the great I Am,
The Christ, the Son of God, the Paschal Lamb,
The Paschal Lamb.

182.title: We'll Sing All Hail to Jesus' Name
182.safe_title: Well Sing All Hail to Jesus Name
lines: 1: We’ll sing all hail to Jesus’ name;
Honor and praise we give
To him who bled on Calvary’s hill
And died that we might live.
2: He passed the portals of the grave,
To rescue fainting souls,
And sits on God’s right hand today,
And all the world controls.

183.title: In Remembrance of Thy Suffering
lines: 1: In remembrance of thy suff’ring,
Lord, our Savior and our God,
We have met to keep thine ordinance,
According to thy word.
2: May our hearts be clean before thee;
May our spirits be renewed,
And our souls rejoice in knowing
We are reconciled to God.

184.title: Upon the Cross of Calvary
lines: 1: Upon the cross of Calvary,
They crucified our Lord and King,
And for the sins of you and me,
His precious blood he there did bring.
Ch: Oh, what a sacrifice was made!
Oh, what a ransom has been paid!
The Son of God, who came to save,
Has triumphed over death and grave.
2: The law of justice was fulfilled;
The debt was paid for me and you.
The law of mercy was revealed,
And God’s great plan was brought to view.
Ch: Oh, what a sacrifice was made!
Oh, what a ransom has been paid!
The Son of God, who came to save,
Has triumphed over death and grave.

185.title: Reverently and Meekly Now
lines: 1: Reverently and meekly now,
Let thy head be bowed in prayer,
While we take the sacrament,
Of the wine and broken bread.
Ask the Lord to bless the cup,
For the blood of Christ was shed,
That if we are faithful, we
May with him be ever one.

186.title: Again We Meet around the Board
lines: 1: Again we meet around the board
Of our dear, risen, living Lord;
With faith in his atoning blood,
We give our hearts to thee, O God.
2: We give our hearts to thee, O God,
And pray that, through the crimson flood,
We may be cleansed from every sin,
And pure and holy be within.

187.title: God Loved Us, So He Sent His Son
lines: 1: God loved us, so he sent his Son,
Christ Jesus, the atoning One,
To show us by the path he trod
The way to virtue and to God.
2: He came his Father’s will to do,
To teach the world salvation’s plan,
To stand for truth and righteousness,
And bring to pass the immortality and eternal life of man.
3: He gave his life that we might live,
And did to all a model give,
That we might learn to do his will,
And on the earth his law fulfill.

188.title: Thy Will, O Lord, Be Done
lines: 1: Thy will, O Lord, be done,
And let us still obey.
Be thou our shield and sun,
Our life, our hope, our stay.
2: We know thou wilt not leave
Thy people in distress.
Thy promise we believe;
Thou wilt thy people bless.

189.title: O Thou, Before the World Began
lines: 1: O thou, before the world began,
Ordained a sacrifice for man,
And by th’ eternal Spirit made
An offering in the sinner’s stead;
2: Our everlasting Priest thou art,
T’ present our off’ring to the heart
Of God, our Father, in whose name
Thy precious sacrifice we claim.

190.title: In Memory of the Crucified
lines: 1: In memory of the Crucified,
Our hearts with gratitude are filled.
In memory of our Lord who died,
We’ve drunk the cup and blessed the bread.
2: He died that we might live anew;
He died to save our souls from sin.
He died that we might all be true,
And by his blood might enter in.

191.title: Behold the Great Redeemer Die
lines: 1: Behold the great Redeemer die,
A broken law to satisfy.
He dies a sacrifice for sin,
That man may live and glory win.
2: While guilty men his pains deride,
They pierce his hands and feet and side;
And with insulting scoffs and scorns,
They crown his head with platted thorns.
3: Although in agony he cried,
“My God, my God, forsake me not,”
No help, no pity was supplied;
But still he drank the bitter cup.

192.title: He Died! The Great Redeemer Died
lines: 1: He died! The great Redeemer died,
And Israel’s daughters wept around.
A solemn darkness veiled the sky;
A sudden trembling shook the ground.
2: Come, saints, and drop a tear or two
For him who groaned beneath your load.
He shed a thousand drops for you,
A thousand drops of richer blood.

193.title: I Stand All Amazed
lines: 1: I stand all amazed at the love Jesus offers me,
Confused at the grace that so fully he proffers me.
I tremble to know that for me he was crucified,
That for me, a sinner, he suffered, he bled and died.
Ch: Oh, it is wonderful that he should care for me
Enough to die for me!
Oh, it is wonderful, wonderful to me!
2: I marvel that he would descend from his throne divine
To rescue a soul so rebellious and proud as mine,
That he should extend his great love unto such as I,
Sufficient to own me, a mortal, once doomed to die.
Ch: Oh, it is wonderful that he should care for me
Enough to die for me!
Oh, it is wonderful, wonderful to me!
3: I think of his hands pierced and bleeding to pay the debt!
Such mercy, such love and devotion can I forget?
No, no, I will praise and adore at the mercy seat,
Until at the glorified throne I kneel at his feet.
Ch: Oh, it is wonderful that he should care for me
Enough to die for me!
Oh, it is wonderful, wonderful to me!

194.title: There Is a Green Hill Far Away
lines: 1: There is a green hill far away,
Without a city wall,
Where the dear Lord was crucified,
Who died to save us all.
2: We may not know, we cannot tell,
What pains he had to bear;
But we believe it was for us
He hung and suffered there.
3: He died that we might be forgiven,
He died to make us good,
That we might go at last to heav’n,
Saved by his precious blood.
4: There was no other good enough
To pay the price of sin;
He only could unlock the gate
Of heav’n and let us in.
5: Oh, dearly, dearly has he loved!
And we must love him too,
And trust in his redeeming blood,
And try his works to do.

195.title: How Great the Wisdom and the Love
lines: 1: How great the wisdom and the love
That filled the courts on high
And sent the Savior from above
To suffer, bleed, and die!
2: His precious blood he freely spilt;
His life he freely gave,
A sinless sacrifice for guilt,
A dying world to save.
3: By strict obedience Jesus won
The prize with glory rife:
“Thy will, O God, not mine, be done,”
Adorned his mortal life.
4: He marked the path and led the way,
And ev’ry point defines
To light and life and endless day
Where God’s full presence shines.
5: How great, how glorious, how complete,
Redemption’s grand design,
Where justice, love, and mercy meet
In harmony divine!

196.title: Jesus, Once of Humble Birth
lines: 1: Jesus, once of humble birth,
Now in glory comes to earth.
Once he suffered grief and pain;
Now he comes on earth to reign.
2: Once a meek and lowly Lamb,
Now the Lord, the great I Am.
Once upon the cross he bowed;
Now his chariot is the cloud.
3: Once he groaned in blood and tears;
Now in glory he appears.
Once rejected by his own,
Now their King on David’s throne.

197.title: O Savior, Thou Who Wearest a Crown
lines: 1: O Savior, thou who wearest a crown
Of mingled light and flame,
Before whose feet the elders bow,
And saints adore thy name.
2: We see thee now in glory bright,
But once thou didst descend,
And in the depths of sorrow’s night
Didst call the poor thy friend.
3: We see thee now, the King of kings,
But once a servant’s form
Thou didst assume, and sorrow’s stings
Didst brave in life’s wild storm.

198.title: That Easter Morn
lines: 1: That Easter morn, so fair and bright,
The first glad day of holy light,
The Savior rose from death’s dark gloom,
And left behind the empty tomb.
2: The angel said, “He is not here;
He is arisen, banish fear.”
The women heard with joy and awe
And went to tell what they had saw.

199.title: He Is Risen!
lines: 1: He is risen! He is risen!
Tell it out with joyful voice.
He has burst his three days’ prison;
Let the whole wide earth rejoice.
Death is conquered, man is free.
Christ has won the victory.
2: Come, ye sad and fearful-hearted,
With glad smile and radiant brow.
Lent’s long shadows have departed;
All his woes are over now,
And the passion that he bore.
Sin and pain can vex no more.
3: Come, with high and holy hymning;
Chant our Lord’s triumphant lay.
Not one darksome cloud is dimming
Yonder glorious morning ray,
Breaking o’er the purple East,
Symbol of our Easter feast.

200.title: Christ the Lord Is Risen Today
lines: 1: Christ the Lord is ris’n today,
Alleluia!
Sons of men and angels say,
Alleluia!
Raise your joys and triumphs high,
Alleluia!
Sing, ye heav’ns, and earth reply,
Alleluia!
2: Love’s redeeming work is done,
Alleluia!
Fought the fight, the vict’ry won,
Alleluia!
Jesus’ agony is o’er,
Alleluia!
Darkness veils the earth no more,
Alleluia!
3: Vain the stone, the watch, the seal,
Alleluia!
Christ hath burst the gates of hell,
Alleluia!
Death in vain forbids him rise,
Alleluia!
Christ hath opened paradise,
Alleluia!
4: Soar we now where Christ has led,
Alleluia!
Foll’wing our exalted Head,
Alleluia!
Made like him, like him we rise,
Alleluia!
Ours the cross, the grave, the skies,
Alleluia!

201.title: Joy to the World
lines: 1: Joy to the world, the Lord is come;
Let earth receive her King!
Let every heart prepare him room,
And Saints and angels sing,
And Saints and angels sing,
And Saints, and Saints and angels sing.
2: Rejoice! rejoice when Jesus reigns,
And Saints their songs employ,
While fields and floods, rocks, hills, and plains,
Repeat the sounding joy,
Repeat the sounding joy,
Repeat, repeat the sounding joy.
3: No more will sin and sorrow grow,
Nor thorns infest the ground;
He’ll come and make the blessings flow
Far as the curse is found,
Far as the curse is found,
Far as, far as the curse is found.
4: Rejoice! rejoice in the Most High,
While Israel spreads abroad,
Like stars that glitter in the sky,
And ever worship God,
And ever worship God,
And ever, and ever worship God.

202.title: Oh, Come, All Ye Faithful
lines: 1: Oh, come, all ye faithful, joyful and triumphant!
Oh, come ye, oh, come ye to Bethlehem.
Come and behold him, born the King of angels.
Ch: Oh, come, let us adore him;
Oh, come, let us adore him;
Oh, come, let us adore him,
Christ, the Lord.
2: Sing, choirs of angels, sing in exultation;
Sing, all ye citizens of heav’n above!
Glory to God, all glory in the highest.
Ch: Oh, come, let us adore him;
Oh, come, let us adore him;
Oh, come, let us adore him,
Christ, the Lord.
3: Yea, Lord, we greet thee, born this happy morning;
Jesus, to thee be all glory giv’n.
Word of the Father, now in flesh appearing.
Ch: Oh, come, let us adore him;
Oh, come, let us adore him;
Oh, come, let us adore him,
Christ, the Lord.

203.title: Angels We Have Heard on High
lines: 1: Angels we have heard on high
Sweetly singing o’er the plains,
And the mountains in reply
Echoing their joyous strains.
Ch: Gloria in excelsis Deo!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
2: Shepherds, why this jubilee?
Why your joyous strains prolong?
What the gladsome tidings be
Which inspire your heav’nly song?
Ch: Gloria in excelsis Deo!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
3: Come to Bethlehem and see
Him whose birth the angels sing;
Come, adore on bended knee
Christ the Lord, the newborn King.
Ch: Gloria in excelsis Deo!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
4: See him in a manger laid,
Whom the choirs of angels praise;
Mary, Joseph, lend your aid,
While our hearts in love we raise.
Ch: Gloria in excelsis Deo!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!

204.title: Silent Night
lines: 1: Silent night! Holy night!
All is calm, all is bright
Round yon virgin mother and child.
Holy Infant, so tender and mild,
Sleep in heavenly peace;
Sleep in heavenly peace.
2: Silent night! Holy night!
Shepherds quake at the sight.
Glories stream from heaven afar;
Heav’nly hosts sing Alleluia!
Christ, the Savior, is born!
Christ, the Savior, is born!
3: Silent night! Holy night!
Son of God, love’s pure light
Radiant beams from thy holy face,
With the dawn of redeeming grace,
Jesus, Lord, at thy birth;
Jesus, Lord, at thy birth.

205.title: Once in Royal David's City
lines: 1: Once in royal David’s city
Stood a lowly cattle shed,
Where a mother laid her baby
In a manger for his bed.
Mary was that mother mild,
Jesus Christ her little child.
2: He came down to earth from heaven,
Who is God and Lord of all,
And his shelter was a stable,
And his cradle was a stall.
With the poor and mean and lowly
Lived on earth our Savior holy.
3: And our eyes at last shall see him,
Through his own redeeming love;
For that child so dear and gentle
Is our Lord in heav’n above,
And he leads his children on
To the place where he is gone.

206.title: Away in a Manger
lines: 1: Away in a manger, no crib for a bed,
The little Lord Jesus laid down his sweet head.
The stars in the bright sky looked down where he lay,
The little Lord Jesus, asleep on the hay.
2: The cattle are lowing, the baby awakes,
But little Lord Jesus, no crying he makes.
I love thee, Lord Jesus; look down from the sky
And stay by my cradle till morning is nigh.
3: Be near me, Lord Jesus; I ask thee to stay
Close by me forever, and love me, I pray.
Bless all the dear children in thy tender care,
And fit us for heaven to live with thee there.

207.title: It Came upon the Midnight Clear
lines: 1: It came upon the midnight clear,
That glorious song of old,
From angels bending near the earth
To touch their harps of gold:
“Peace on the earth, good will to men,
From heav’n’s all-gracious King.”
The world in solemn stillness lay
To hear the angels sing.
2: Still through the cloven skies they come
With peaceful wings unfurled,
And still their heav’nly music floats
O’er all the weary world.
Above its sad and lowly plains
They bend on hov’ring wing,
And ever o’er its babel sounds
The blessed angels sing.
3: For lo! the days are hast’ning on,
By prophets seen of old,
When with the ever-circling years
Shall come the time foretold,
When the new heav’n and earth shall own
The Prince of Peace their King,
And the whole world send back the song
Which now the angels sing.

208.title: O Little Town of Bethlehem
lines: 1: O little town of Bethlehem,
How still we see thee lie!
Above thy deep and dreamless sleep
The silent stars go by.
Yet in thy dark streets shineth
The everlasting Light;
The hopes and fears of all the years
Are met in thee tonight.
2: For Christ is born of Mary,
And gathered all above,
While mortals sleep, the angels keep
Their watch of wond’ring love.
O morning stars, together
Proclaim the holy birth,
And praises sing to God the King,
And peace to men on earth.
3: How silently, how silently,
The wondrous gift is giv’n!
So God imparts to human hearts
The blessings of his heav’n.
No ear may hear his coming;
But in this world of sin,
Where meek souls will receive him, still
The dear Christ enters in.
4: O holy Child of Bethlehem,
Descend to us, we pray;
Cast out our sin and enter in;
Be born in us today.
We hear the Christmas angels
The great glad tidings tell;
Oh, come to us, abide with us,
Our Lord Immanuel.

209.title: Hark! The Herald Angels Sing
lines: 1: Hark! the herald angels sing,
“Glory to the newborn King!
Peace on earth, and mercy mild,
God and sinners reconciled.”
Joyful, all ye nations, rise;
Join the triumph of the skies;
With th’angelic host proclaim,
“Christ is born in Bethlehem!”
Ch: Hark! the herald angels sing,
“Glory to the newborn King!”
2: Christ, by highest heav’n adored,
Christ, the everlasting Lord,
Late in time behold him come,
Offspring of a virgin’s womb.
Veiled in flesh the Godhead see;
Hail th’incarnate Deity.
Pleased as man with man to dwell,
Jesus, our Immanuel!
Ch: Hark! the herald angels sing,
“Glory to the newborn King!”
3: Hail the heav’n-born Prince of Peace!
Hail the Son of Righteousness!
Light and life to all he brings,
Ris’n with healing in his wings.
Mild he lays his glory by,
Born that man no more may die,
Born to raise the sons of earth,
Born to give them second birth.
Ch: Hark! the herald angels sing,
“Glory to the newborn King!”

210.title: With Wondering Awe
lines: 1: With wondering awe the wise men saw
The star in heaven springing,
And with delight, in peaceful night,
They heard the angels singing.
Ch: Hosanna, hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!
Hosanna, hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!
2: By prophets old it was foretold
He’d be a man of sorrow.
By heathen hands in foreign lands
He’d be a stranger tomorrow.
Ch: Hosanna, hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!
Hosanna, hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!
3: He had no home, but yet he’s come
To save the world from sorrow,
And from his throne, when he comes home,
He’ll rule the world tomorrow.
Ch: Hosanna, hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!
Hosanna, hosanna, hosanna to God and the Lamb!

211.title: While Shepherds Watched Their Flocks
lines: 1: While shepherds watched their flocks by night,
All seated on the ground,
The angel of the Lord came down,
And glory shone around.
And glory shone around.
2: “Fear not,” said he, for mighty dread
Had seized their troubled mind.
“Glad tidings of great joy I bring
To you and all mankind,
To you and all mankind.
3: “To you, in David’s town, this day
Is born of David’s line
A Savior, who is Christ the Lord,
And this shall be the sign,
And this shall be the sign:
4: “The heav’nly babe you there shall find
To human view displayed,
All meanly wrapped in swathing bands,
And in a manger laid,
And in a manger laid.”
5: Thus spake the seraph, and forthwith
Appeared a shining throng
Of angels praising God, who thus
Addressed their joyful song,
Addressed their joyful song:
6: “All glory be to God on high,
And to the earth be peace;
Good will henceforth from heav’n to men
Begin and never cease,
Begin and never cease.”

212.title: Far, Far Away on Judea's Plains
212.safe_title: Far, Far Away on Judeas Plains
lines: 1: Far, far away on Judea’s plains,
Shepherds of old heard the joyous strains:
Glory to God, Glory to God,
Glory to God in the highest;
Peace on earth, good will to men;
Peace on earth, good will to men.
2: Sweet are these strains of redeeming love,
Message of mercy from heaven above:
Glory to God, Glory to God,
Glory to God in the highest;
Peace on earth, good will to men;
Peace on earth, good will to men.
3: Lord, with the angels we too would rejoice;
Help us to sing with the heart and voice:
Glory to God, Glory to God,
Glory to God in the highest;
Peace on earth, good will to men;
Peace on earth, good will to men.
4: Hasten the time when, from every clime,
Men shall unite in the strains sublime:
Glory to God, Glory to God,
Glory to God in the highest;
Peace on earth, good will to men;
Peace on earth, good will to men.

213.title: The First Noel
lines: 1: The first Noel the angel did say
Was to certain poor shepherds in fields as they lay;
In fields where they lay keeping their sheep
On a cold winter’s night that was so deep.
Ch: Noel, Noel, Noel, Noel!
Born is the King of Israel.
2: They looked up and saw a star
Shining in the east, beyond them far,
And to the earth it gave great light,
And so it continued both day and night.
Ch: Noel, Noel, Noel, Noel!
Born is the King of Israel.
3: This star drew nigh to the northwest;
O’er Bethlehem it took its rest,
And there it did both stop and stay,
Right over the place where Jesus lay.
Ch: Noel, Noel, Noel, Noel!
Born is the King of Israel.
4: Then entered in those wise men three,
Full rev’rently upon their knee,
And offered there, in his presence,
Their gold and myrrh and frankincense.
Ch: Noel, Noel, Noel, Noel!
Born is the King of Israel.

214.title: I Heard the Bells on Christmas Day
lines: 1: I heard the bells on Christmas Day
Their old, familiar carols play,
And wild and sweet the words repeat
Of peace on earth, good will to men.
2: I thought how, as the day had come,
The belfries of all Christendom
Had rolled along th’unbroken song
Of peace on earth, good will to men.
3: And in despair I bowed my head:
“There is no peace on earth,” I said,
“For hate is strong and mocks the song
Of peace on earth, good will to men.”
4: Then pealed the bells more loud and deep:
“God is not dead, nor doth he sleep;
The wrong shall fail, the right prevail,
With peace on earth, good will to men.”

215.title: Ring Out, Wild Bells
lines: 1: Ring out, wild bells, to the wild sky,
The flying cloud, the frosty light;
The year is dying in the night;
Ring out, wild bells, and let him die.
2: Ring out the old, ring in the new;
Ring, happy bells, across the snow.
The year is going, let him go;
Ring out the false, ring in the true.
3: Ring out the grief that saps the mind,
For those that here we see no more;
Ring out the feud of rich and poor;
Ring in redress to all mankind.
4: Ring out a slowly dying cause
And ancient forms of party strife;
Ring in the nobler modes of life,
With sweeter manners, purer laws.
5: Ring out the want, the care, the sin,
The faithless coldness of the times;
Ring out, ring out my mournful rhymes,
But ring the fuller minstrel in.
6: Ring in the valiant man and free,
The larger heart, the kindlier hand;
Ring out the darkness of the land;
Ring in the Christ that is to be.

216.title: We Are Sowing
lines: 1: We are sowing, daily sowing,
Countless seeds of good and ill,
Scattered on the fertile mission,
Waiting for our hands to till.
Here a word of love and kindness,
There a word of harsh command,
Each a seed with fruit encircled,
Sown in some waiting land.
2: We are sowing, daily sowing,
Seeds of thought and deed and word;
And the harvest will be coming,
When the Master’s call is heard.
Are we sowing seeds of kindness?
Are we sowing seeds of truth?
Are we sowing for the Master
In the sunny hours of youth?

217.title: Come, Let Us Anew
lines: 1: Come, let us anew our journey pursue,
Roll round with the year,
And never stand still till the Master appear.
His adorable will let us gladly fulfill,
And our talents improve
By the patience of hope and the labor of love,
By the patience of hope and the labor of love.
2: Our life is a dream; our time, as a stream,
Glides swiftly away,
And the fugitive moment refuses to stay.
The arrow is flown; the moment is gone;
The millennial year
Rushes on to our view, and eternity’s here,
Rushes on to our view, and eternity’s here.
3: Oh, that each in the day of his coming may say,
“I have fought my way thru;
I have finished the work thou didst give me to do.”
Oh, that each from his Lord may receive the glad word,
“Well and faithfully done;
Enter into my joy and sit down on my throne,
Enter into my joy and sit down on my throne.”

218.title: We Give Thee But Thine Own
lines: 1: We give thee but thine own,
Whate’er the gift may be;
All that we have is thine alone,
A trust, O Lord, from thee.
2: May we thy bounties thus
As stewards true receive,
And gladly, as thou blessest us,
To thee our first fruits give.
3: To comfort and to bless,
To find a balm for woe,
To tend the lone and fatherless
Is angels’ work below.
4: The captive to release,
To God the lost to bring,
To teach the way of life and peace—
It is a Christlike thing.
5: And we believe thy word,
Though dim our faith may be;
Whate’er for thine we do, O Lord,
We do it unto thee.

219.title: Because I Have Been Given Much
lines: 1: Because I have been given much,
I too must give;
Because of thy great bounty, Lord,
Each day I live
I shall divide my gifts from thee
With every brother that I see
Who has the need of help from me.
2: Because I have been sheltered, fed,
By thy good care,
I cannot see another’s lack
And I not share
My glowing fire, my loaf of bread,
My roof’s safe shelter overhead,
That he too may be comforted.
3: Because I have been blessed by thy
Great love, dear Lord,
I’ll share thy love again,
According to thy word.
I shall give love to those in need;
I’ll show that love by word and deed:
Thus shall my thanks be thanks in deed.

220.title: Lord, I Would Follow Thee
lines: 1: Savior, may I learn to love thee,
Walk the path that thou hast shown,
Pause to help and lift another,
Finding strength beyond my own.
Savior, may I learn to love thee—
Ch: Lord, I would follow thee.
2: Who am I to judge another
When I walk imperfectly?
In the quiet heart is hidden
Sorrow that the eye can’t see.
Who am I to judge another?–
Ch: Lord, I would follow thee.
3: I would be my brother’s keeper;
I would learn the healer’s art.
To the wounded and the weary
I would show a gentle heart.
I would be my brother’s keeper—
Ch: Lord, I would follow thee.
4: Savior, may I love my brother
As I know thou lovest me,
Find in thee my strength, my beacon,
For thy servant I would be.
Savior, may I love my brother—
Ch: Lord, I would follow thee.

221.title: Dear to the Heart of the Shepherd
lines: 1: Dear to the heart of the Shepherd,
Dear are the sheep of his fold;
Dear is the love that he gives them,
Dearer than silver or gold.
Dear to the heart of the Shepherd,
Dear are his other lost sheep;
Over the mountains he follows,
Over the waters so deep.
Ch: Out in the desert they wander,
Hungry and helpless and cold;
Off to the rescue he hastens,
Bringing them back to the fold.
2: Dear to the heart of the Shepherd,
Dear are the lambs of his fold;
He will protect them from danger,
Gather them safe in his fold.
Dear to the heart of the Shepherd,
For them he suffered and died;
For them in his glory he’s pleading,
Pleading for them at God’s side.
Ch: Out in the desert they wander,
Hungry and helpless and cold;
Off to the rescue he hastens,
Bringing them back to the fold.
3: Hark! he is earnestly calling,
Tenderly pleading today:
“Will you not seek for my lost ones,
Wand’ring so far, far away?”
Green are the pastures of promise,
Where in his goodness we feed.
Go, then, and feed my poor lost ones;
That is the errand of need.
Ch: Out in the desert they wander,
Hungry and helpless and cold;
Off to the rescue he hastens,
Bringing them back to the fold.

222.title: Hear Thou Our Hymn, O Lord
lines: 1: Hear thou our hymn, O Lord,
In this our humble pray’r.
Help us to understand thy word
And all thy goodness share.
2: We thank thee for thy Son,
Who came to earth to die,
That he might save us from our sins,
And bring us home on high.

223.title: Have I Done Any Good?
lines: 1: Have I done any good in the world today?
Have I helped anyone in need?
Have I cheered up the sad and made someone feel glad?
If not, I have failed indeed.
Has anyone’s burden been lighter today
Because I was willing to share?
Have the sick and the weary been helped on their way?
When they needed my help was I there?
Ch: Then wake up and do something more
Than dream of your mansion above.
Doing good is a pleasure, a joy beyond measure,
A blessing of duty and love.
2: There are chances for work all around just now,
Opportunities right in our way.
Do not let them pass by, saying, “Sometime I’ll try,”
But go and do something today.
’Tis noble of man to work and to give;
Love’s labor has merit alone.
Only he who does something helps others to live.
To God each good work will be known.
Ch: Then wake up and do something more
Than dream of your mansion above.
Doing good is a pleasure, a joy beyond measure,
A blessing of duty and love.

224.title: I Have Work Enough to Do
lines: 1: I have work enough to do,
Ere the sun goes down,
For myself and for my God,
And the souls of fellowmen.
2: I must speak a word of cheer
To a brother in distress,
And the sorrow of his heart
I must try to make it less.
3: I have work enough to do;
Let me do it with my might,
For the day is passing by,
And will soon be gone the night.

225.title: We Are Marching On to Glory
lines: 1: We are marching on to glory;
We are on our journey home.
We are pilgrims and are strangers;
Here on earth we have no home.
2: We are marching on to glory,
And our armor is all bright.
We will fight for God and Zion,
And will conquer in the fight.

226.title: Improve the Shining Moments
lines: 1: Improve the shining moments;
Don’t let them pass you by.
Work while the sun is radiant;
Work, for the night is nigh.
2: We cannot be too busy,
Engaged in doing good,
Supplying to the hungry
A daily need of food.
3: The moments we are losing
May never be regained,
And if we are not careful,
Our talent is restrained.

227.title: There Is Sunshine in My Soul Today
lines: 1: There is sunshine in my soul today,
More glorious and bright
Than glows in any earthly sky,
For Jesus is my light.
Ch: Oh, there’s sunshine, blessed sunshine,
When the peaceful, happy moments roll.
When Jesus shows his smiling face,
There is sunshine in my soul.
2: There is music in my soul today,
A carol to my King,
And Jesus, listening, can hear
The songs I cannot sing.
Ch: Oh, there’s sunshine, blessed sunshine,
When the peaceful, happy moments roll.
When Jesus shows his smiling face,
There is sunshine in my soul.
3: There is springtime in my soul today,
For when the Lord is near,
The dove of peace sings in my heart,
The flow’rs of grace appear.
Ch: Oh, there’s sunshine, blessed sunshine,
When the peaceful, happy moments roll.
When Jesus shows his smiling face,
There is sunshine in my soul.
4: There is gladness in my soul today,
And hope and praise and love,
For blessings which he gives me now,
For joys “laid up” above.
Ch: Oh, there’s sunshine, blessed sunshine,
When the peaceful, happy moments roll.
When Jesus shows his smiling face,
There is sunshine in my soul.

228.title: You Can Make the Pathway Bright
lines: 1: You can make the pathway bright,
Fill the soul with heaven’s light,
If you’ll only follow Jesus,
And obey his holy light.
Ch: You can make the pathway bright;
Fill the soul with heaven’s light;
If you’ll only follow Jesus,
And obey his holy light.
2: You can make the pathway bright;
You can make the burden light;
If you’ll only help another
Bear his burden in the fight.
Ch: You can make the pathway bright;
Fill the soul with heaven’s light;
If you’ll only follow Jesus,
And obey his holy light.
3: You can make the pathway bright;
You can make the future right;
If you’ll only trust in Jesus,
And obey with all your might.
Ch: You can make the pathway bright;
Fill the soul with heaven’s light;
If you’ll only follow Jesus,
And obey his holy light.

229.title: Today, While the Sun Shines
lines: 1: Today, while the sun shines, work with a will;
Today, all your duties with patience fulfill.
Today, while the birds sing, work and be gay;
Let’s improve every moment, ’twill soon pass away.
2: Today, while the sun shines, scatter the seed;
Today, help a brother in time of his need.
Today, show your kindness to all who may roam;
Today, help the stranger, far, far from his home.

230.title: Scatter Sunshine
lines: 1: In a world where sorrow
Ever will be known,
Where are found the needy,
And the sad and lone,
How much joy and comfort
You can all bestow,
If you scatter sunshine
Everywhere you go.
Ch: Scatter sunshine all along your way.
Cheer and bless and brighten every passing day.
Scatter sunshine all along your way.
Cheer and bless and brighten every passing day.
2: Slightest actions often
Meet the sorest needs,
For the world wants daily
Little kindly deeds.
Oh, what care and sorrow
You may help remove,
With your songs and courage,
Sympathy and love.
Ch: Scatter sunshine all along your way.
Cheer and bless and brighten every passing day.
Scatter sunshine all along your way.
Cheer and bless and brighten every passing day.

231.title: Father, Cheer Our Souls Tonight
lines: 1: Father, cheer our souls tonight;
Lift our burdens, make them light.
Let thine all-pervading love
Shine upon us from above.
2: Calm the surges of the soul;
Bid the dark waves backward roll.
Let us all thy mercies feel
Thru the pow'r thou dost reveal.
3: Bless our loved ones far away;
Grant them health and peace, we pray.
In their hearts let holy light
Beam to guide their steps aright.
4: Let implicit faith and trust
Help us know thy ways are just.
May thine ever-tender love
Lead our hearts to thee above.

232.title: Let Us Oft Speak Kind Words
lines: 1: Let us oft speak kind words to each other
At home or where'er we may be;
Like the warblings of birds on the heather,
The tones will be welcome and free.
They'll gladden the heart that's repining,
Give courage and hope from above,
And where the dark clouds hide the shining,
Let in the bright sunlight of love.
Ch: Oh, the kind words we give shall in memory live
And sunshine forever impart.
Let us oft speak kind words to each other;
Kind words are sweet tones of the heart.
2: Like the sunbeams of morn on the mountains,
The soul they awake to good cheer;
Like the murmur of cool, pleasant fountains,
They fall in sweet cadences near.
Let's oft, then, in kindly toned voices,
Our mutual friendship renew,
Till heart meets with heart and rejoices
In friendship that ever is true.
Ch: Oh, the kind words we give shall in memory live
And sunshine forever impart.
Let us oft speak kind words to each other;
Kind words are sweet tones of the heart.

233.title: Nay, Speak No Ill
lines: 1: Nay, speak no ill; a kindly word
Can never leave a sting behind;
And, oh, to breathe each tale we've heard
Is far beneath a noble mind.
Full oft a better seed is sown
By choosing thus the kinder plan,
For, if but little good is known,
Still let us speak the best we can.
2: Give me the heart that fain would hide,
Would fain another's faults efface.
How can it please the human pride
To prove humanity but base?
No, let us reach a higher mood,
A nobler estimate of man;
Be earnest in the search for good,
And speak of all the best we can.
3: Then speak no ill, but lenient be
To others' failings as your own.
If you're the first a fault to see,
Be not the first to make it known,
For life is but a passing day;
No lip may tell how brief its span.
Then, oh, the little time we stay,
Let's speak of all the best we can.

234.title: Jesus, Mighty King in Zion
lines: 1: Jesus, mighty King in Zion,
Thou alone our guide shalt be.
Thy commission we rely on;
We will follow none but thee.
2: As an emblem of thy passion
And thy vict'ry o'er the grave,
We, who know thy great salvation,
Are baptized beneath the wave.
3: Fearless of the world's despising,
We the ancient path pursue,
Buried with the Lord and rising
To a life divinely new.

235.title: Should You Feel Inclined to Censure
lines: 1: Should you feel inclined to censure
Faults you may in others view,
Ask your own heart, ere you venture,
If you have not failings, too.
Let not friendly vows be broken;
Rather strive a friend to gain.
Many words in anger spoken
Find their passage home again.
2: Do not, then, in idle pleasure
Trifle with a brother's fame;
Guard it as a valued treasure,
Sacred as your own good name.
Do not form opinions blindly;
Hastiness to trouble tends;
Those of whom we thought unkindly
Oft become our warmest friends.

236.title: Lord, Accept into Thy Kingdom
lines: 1: Lord, accept into thy kingdom
Each repentant, humbled one,
Born of water and the Spirit
In thy name, Beloved Son.
Let the Holy Ghost, descending,
Comfort, guide the path of youth,
Channel of all light and glory,
Key to vision, knowledge, truth.
2: Know ye not that he was holy?
Yet he witnessed unto men
That the way is straight and narrow
Leading unto God again.
Hark, glad tidings of salvation.
Hear his word, "Come, follow me
Unto glory in my kingdom,
Unto life eternally."
3: Like the sound of rushing waters
In this day his word is said:
Holy ordinance of mercy
For the living and the dead!
Let your hearts rejoice in gladness!
Let the earth break forth and sing!
Let the dead speak praising anthems
To our God, eternal King!

237.title: Do What Is Right
lines: 1: Do what is right; the day-dawn is breaking,
Hailing a future of freedom and light.
Angels above us are silent notes taking
Of ev’ry action; then do what is right!
Ch: Do what is right; let the consequence follow.
Battle for freedom in spirit and might;
And with stout hearts look ye forth till tomorrow.
God will protect you; then do what is right!
2: Do what is right; the shackles are falling.
Chains of the bondsmen no longer are bright;
Lightened by hope, soon they'll cease to be galling.
Truth goeth onward; then do what is right!
Ch: Do what is right; let the consequence follow.
Battle for freedom in spirit and might;
And with stout hearts look ye forth till tomorrow.
God will protect you; then do what is right!
3: Do what is right; be faithful and fearless.
Onward, press onward, the goal is in sight.
Eyes that are wet now, ere long will be tearless.
Blessings await you in doing what's right!
Ch: Do what is right; let the consequence follow.
Battle for freedom in spirit and might;
And with stout hearts look ye forth till tomorrow.
God will protect you; then do what is right!

238.title: Behold Thy Sons and Daughters, Lord
lines: 1: Behold thy sons and daughters, Lord,
On whom we lay our hands.
They have fulfilled the gospel word
And bowed at thy commands.
2: Oh, now send down the heav’nly dove
And overwhelm their souls
With peace and joy and perfect love,
As lambs within thy fold.
3: Seal them by thine own Spirit's pow’r,
Which purifies from sin,
And may they find, from this good hour,
They are adopted in.
4: Increase their faith, confirm their hope,
And guide them in the way.
With comfort bear their spirits up
Until the perfect day.

239.title: Choose the Right
lines: 1: Choose the right when a choice is placed before you.
In the right the Holy Spirit guides;
And its light is forever shining o'er you,
When in the right your heart confides.
Ch: Choose the right! Choose the right!
Let wisdom mark the way before.
In its light, choose the right!
And God will bless you evermore.
2: Choose the right! Let no spirit of digression
Overcome you in the evil hour.
There's the right and the wrong to ev'ry question;
Be safe thru inspiration's pow'r.
Ch: Choose the right! Choose the right!
Let wisdom mark the way before.
In its light, choose the right!
And God will bless you evermore.
3: Choose the right! There is peace in righteous doing.
Choose the right! There's safety for the soul.
Choose the right in all labors you're pursuing;
Let God and heaven be your goal.
Ch: Choose the right! Choose the right!
Let wisdom mark the way before.
In its light, choose the right!
And God will bless you evermore.

240.title: Know This, That Every Soul Is Free
lines: 1: Know this, that ev’ry soul is free
To choose his life and what he'll be;
For this eternal truth is giv'n:
That God will force no man to heav'n.
2: He'll call, persuade, direct aright,
And bless with wisdom, love, and light,
In nameless ways be good and kind,
But never force the human mind.
3: Freedom and reason make us men;
Take these away, what are we then?
Mere animals, and just as well
The beasts may think of heav'n or hell.
4: May we no more our pow'rs abuse,
But ways of truth and goodness choose;
Our God is pleased when we improve
His grace and seek his perfect love.

241.title: Count Your Blessings
lines: 1: When upon life's billows you are tempest-tossed,
When you are discouraged, thinking all is lost,
Count your many blessings; name them one by one,
And it will surprise you what the Lord has done.
Ch: Count your blessings; name them one by one.
Count your blessings; see what God hath done.
Count your blessings; name them one by one.
Count your many blessings; see what God hath done.
2: Are you ever burdened with a load of care?
Does the cross seem heavy you are called to bear?
Count your many blessings; ev’ry doubt will fly,
And you will be singing as the days go by.
Ch: Count your blessings; name them one by one.
Count your blessings; see what God hath done.
Count your blessings; name them one by one.
Count your many blessings; see what God hath done.
3: When you look at others with their lands and gold,
Think that Christ has promised you his wealth untold.
Count your many blessings; money cannot buy
Your reward in heaven nor your home on high.
Ch: Count your blessings; name them one by one.
Count your blessings; see what God hath done.
Count your blessings; name them one by one.
Count your many blessings; see what God hath done.
4: So amid the conflict, whether great or small,
Do not be discouraged; God is over all.
Count your many blessings; angels will attend,
Help and comfort give you to your journey’s end.
Ch: Count your blessings; name them one by one.
Count your blessings; see what God hath done.
Count your blessings; name them one by one.
Count your many blessings; see what God hath done.

242.title: Praise God, from Whom All Blessings Flow
lines: 1: Praise God, from whom all blessings flow;
Praise him, all creatures here below;
Praise him above, ye heav'nly host;
Praise Father, Son, and Holy Ghost.

243.title: Let Us All Press On
lines: 1: Let us all press on in the work of the Lord,
That when life is o'er we may gain a reward;
In the fight for right let us wield a sword,
The mighty sword of truth.
Ch: Fear not, though the enemy deride;
Courage, for the Lord is on our side.
We will heed not what the wicked may say,
But the Lord alone we will obey.
